K. al-ʿAbādilah
كتاب العبادله

2

Full

<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Date or place of composition is not known. But it must be before 626H, as there is a samāʿ on Shehit Ali 2826 dated 22nd of Dhū al-Ḥijja 626H.
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A treatise on the servants of God according to the different character traits (akhlāq) of the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil). Each servant (ʿabd Allāh) represents a spiritual modality symbolised by the association of a Divine Name and the name of a particular prophet or saint. The work is in two parts; the first consisting of 50 ʿabādila divided into five sections, the second of 67. Pablo Beneito supports Michel Chodkiewicz in relating the first 114 to the 114 suras of the Qurʾān.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 16 mss., at least seven of which can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Aga 4859, a partial holograph with a samāʿ dated 641H. Different copies have different numbers of chapters: Ayasofia 4817 and Yusuf Aga 4859 have 117, Shehit Ali 2826 114, the Cairo printed edition (1969) 96. According to Pablo Beneito, who has made a detailed study of the text, 117 is the correct number.
Date
Manuscript
Title

Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
A critical edition is in progress by Pablo Beneito and Souad Hakim. A translation into Spanish is also in progress. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
‘Al-tāwīl fī K. al-ʿAbādila ‘ by Souad Hakīm (Arabic) in Symbolisme et Herméneutique dans la pensée de Ibn ‘Arabī , Damascus, 2007. ‘On the Spiritual typologies in Ibn 'Arabi's Kitab al-Abadila’ by Pablo Beneito (English) given at the Ibn Arabi Symposium, "Boundless Human Potential", Worcester College, Oxford, May 2011. Podcast available from the MIAS web-site http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/podcasts/index.html.
أبحاث
Additions

Beneito and Suad Hakim working on a critical edition.

Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Yusuf Aga 4859 Work stolen. Photocopy in MIAS Library (Ms/158) (S.H.) Mss. (SH) Koprulu 713, 45a-80b Dated 663H Ayasofya 4817 Dated 649H, possibly read before SQ - see Elmore, JMIAS XXIII for details Sheiht Ali 2826, 6b-61b Dated 721H in Cairo, copy of 2 original sama' - The listeners were: al-Qutb al-din M, son of …Shams al-din Isma'il Ibn Sawdakin, Sadr al-din Qunawi , al-Maqri and Abu Bakr b.M. b. Abu Bakr al-Balkhi. Dated 22 Dhu'l-Hijja 621H. We can assume that the reader was Ayyub b. Badr al-Maqri, who copied many works in 621H in Damascus. Chester Beatty 3643 Written in Malatya c.700H Yusuf Aga 4892 Dated 716H according to catalogue. Poor copy.

K. al-Ajwiba al-ʿArabiyya fī sharḥ al-naṣāʾiḥ al-Yūsufiyya
كتاب الأجوبة العربية في شرح النصائح الوسفية
RG №
9
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ajwiba
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Ajwiba al-ʿArabiyya fī sharḥ al-naṣāʾiḥ al-Yūsufiyya
كتاب الأجوبة العربية في شرح النصائح الوسفية
موحد
Full
K. al-Ajwiba al-ʿarabiyya fi sharḥ al-naṣāiḥ al-yūsufiyya
كامل

Note on Title

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<700
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Wise sayings, accompanied by explanatory notes. IA says in the introduction that it is a collection of sayings by a certain mystic called ʿAlī al-Kurdī who was ‘smitten with divine love’, and he has appended a commentary on these sayings. Claude Addas adds: “Al-Ajwiba al-‘Arabiyya fî sharh al-nasâ’ih al-Yûsufiyya est une commentaire par Ibn ‘Arabî d’une risâla concernant les devoirs du murîd à l’égard de son shaykh rédigée par Yûsuf b. Ibrâhîm al-Shâfi’î sous l’inspiration de la rûhâniya de ‘Alî al-Kurdî, un “fou” (muwallah ) notoire de Damas (I.A. l’a rencontré, cf.,Fut., II, 522, ed. Bûlaq).”
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss. of which two, Husein Celebi 447 and Yusuf Aga 4860, although undated, are very early, whilst Yusuf Aga 4860 is from SQ’s library, and is possibly 7th or 8th century. The internal evidence of the text – for example, the language and the mention of his wife – is strong evidence that it is by IA. In addition, the title is listed in one of the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142), and it does not seem to be attributed to anyone else. Claude Addas confirms this stating that:: “L’attribution de ce texte à Ibn ‘Arabî ne fait aucun doute ; on y trouve de nombreuses références autobiographiques, par ex, l’investiture de la khirqa par ‘Abd Allâh b. Jâmī”.A number of the poems in this work appear clustered in the Paris Diwan (B.N. 2348) and seemingly nowhere else. Further information on the fully digitized text of RG 9 found in Word format at cb.rayaheen.net/userfiles/download.php?id=1395‎, which extracts as a Word document with name شرح روحانية الشيخ الكردي.doc. The text itself carries a title not listed by Osman Yahia under RG 9, namely: شرح ما نطقت به روحانية سيدي علي الكردي . JC has compared that text to Yusuf Aga 4860 and Husein Celebi 447. The 202 page text in the Word document closely matches the complete text found in Husein Celebi 447 ff.1a-149b. Decapitated Yusuf Aga 4860 p.207 – which we estimate is missing the first 14 pages (7 folios) – starts with the text found at the end of page 11 of the Word document (cf. Husein Celebi f.9a line 2). PDF versions are also available via Google (شرح روحانية الشيخ الكردي لسيدي ابن عربي.pdf).

تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Husein Celebi 447, 1-149b, copied after 638 as IA is referred to with radi' Allahu 'anhu. 1a contains following title: K. al-ajwiba al-'arabiya fi sharh al-nasa'ih al-yusufiya li-sayyidina al-imam al-'alim al-rasikh Muhyiddin Abu 'Abdullah M. b. 'A b. M. b. Ahmad b. 'Abdullah b. al-'Arabi al-Ta'i al-Hatimi. This is rare example of four generations in the name. The other contents of book: 1) Sharh arba'in hadith lil-Qunawi 2) Tafsir al-fatiha lil-Qashani 3) Sharh inna Allahu khalaqa Adam 'ala suratihi Yusuf Aga 4860 (new numbering) 4th in book, up to p. 449 but not clear where it actually starts From SH
msAdditions
Husein Çelebi 447, 450/2 R. Copied in the life of the author.

People: IA is also commentator: <persName role="cwt" key="person_0001">Ibn al-ʿArabī</persName> Yûsuf b. Ibrâhîm al-Shâfi’î as antecdent: <persName role="ant" key="person_0000"> Yūsuf b. Ibrāhīm al-Shāfiʾī</persName> Related item (non-IA): commentary on risala by ʿAlī al-Kurdī. is it known or unknown? Alternate title: Sharḥ rūḥāniyya al-shaykh al-Kurdī

K. al-Alif wa-huwa kitāb al-aḥadiyya
كتاب الألف وهو كتاب الأحدية

أقدم شاهد

نطاق زمني
‘I composed it in Jerusalem (Bayt al-Muqaddas) in an hour of the daytime.’” (Vel.51/19a)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the unity symbolically represented by the letter Alif. Alternative title is K. al-Aḥadiyya.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Over 30 mss. are listed by OY, of which six can be considered to be historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813, which was copied by Ayyūb b. Badr and read in front of IA in Damascus in 621H. According to OY, the work was written in 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that no date is given. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley, Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyuddin 51, JMIAS, 40 (2006), pp. 101-116.)

Manuscript

منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.

أبحاث

Publications K. al-alif , Beirut, 1997 (in Rasa⁄il Ibn ‘Arabi) K. al-Alif wa huwa kitåb al-aπadiyya, Cairo, 1996 Corr. L'ouvrage traduit par Weir (trad. Rédigée à Londres en 1976) est bien, comme O. Y. le supposait, la R. fî l ahadiyya (RG. 13) et non le K. al-alif. (MC)
Translated by A. Abadi in JMIAS

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
Attribution The work translated by Weir in JRAS 1901, pp. 809-825, (published in London 1976 as Whose Knoweth Himself…) is actually, as OY thought, R. fî l ahadiyya (RG. 13) and not K. al-alif. Mss. Veliyuddin 51, pp 19a-26b. Inspection by JC/SH confirms that it was copied in 762H from an original in the Shaykh’s hand, but fails to reveal any mention of Jerusalem or the date 601H on this particular work. Shehit Ali 2813, 35a- 41a. Inspection by JC/SH reveals that this was written by Ayy¬b b. Badr in 621H in Damascus and read in front of Ibn ‘Arab∆.
additions
Publications K. al-alif , Beirut, 1997 (in Rasa⁄il Ibn ‘Arabi) K. al-Alif wa huwa kitåb al-aπadiyya, Cairo, 1996 Corr. L'ouvrage traduit par Weir (trad. Rédigée à Londres en 1976) est bien, comme O. Y. le supposait, la R. fî l ahadiyya (RG. 13) et non le K. al-alif. (MC) Re: RG. 26. K. al-Alif Carulla 2111, 26a-31b Shehit Ali 2813, 35-41 Listeners: the qadi Mu'inuddin (?) Abu Ishaq Ibrahim, son of the qadi Majduddin 'Umar, son of the qadi 'Abd al-'Aziz al-Qurashi; also, companion and friend of Shaykh, Abu Ishaq Ibrahim b. Ahmad al-Qurtubi (r.a.) Hudai 517, 10b-13a Written by Hudayi in 999H From SH
msAdditions
Corr.
JC
MC
AAS
Root
CA
SH
JC
AK
MM
AP
Dating: The title K. al-Alif wa huwa k. al-ahadiyya is written on 19a, and underneath there is a note, which we believe is in the same hand, that translates as: Composed by Muhyî al-dîn ibn al-‘Arabî, who said (may God have mercy on him) “I composed it in Jerusalem (bayt al-muqaddas) in an hour in the daytime.” On 26a, at the end, a further note repeats this information and adds that the original was in Ibn ‘Arabî’s handwriting. Osman Yahia again concludes, on the basis of this second note, that the text was written in Jerusalem in 601,[10] but we could not find a date. The year 601 would be a reasonable conjecture, however, given the other notes in the collection. Title: Can be seen as two alternate titles or one full title... Mentions: <note type=“mention”> <ref target="#huruf">IA refers to Kitāb al-Ḥurūf, which may be different from Madkhal fī ʿilm al-ḥurūf in the final paragraph of Kitāb al-Alif</ref> <p/> <quote xml:lang="ara">وقد ذكرنا هذا كله في كتاب الحروف لنا مستوفى فلينطر هناك</quote> </note> <note type=“mention”> <ref target="#jalala">Kitāb al-Jalāla, also mentioned in the final paragraph</ref> <p/> <quote xml:lang="ara">تم كتاب الأحدية وهو كتاب الألف ويتلوه إن شاء الله كتاب الجلالة</quote> </note> Could this be related to the Fihris’s alphanumerical sequence?

K. al-Amr al-muḥkam

درجة الصحة

توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
602
تاريخ
Earliest MS
724
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
In Damascus in Jumada al-ūla 602H (see Vel.51/110b)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The title translates as “The Firm Rule regarding the conditions necessary for people on God’s Path”. The aim of the work is to give advice to spiritual guides on the kind of language and teaching which should be offered to different types of students.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least six historic mss, three of them definitely copied from originals. The best are Shehit Ali 1341, written around 724H in Damascus, copied from an original by IA and certified by him, and Ayasofya 4875 (probably dated 705H). OY believed the work was written in Konya in 602H on basis of a note in Veliyuddin 51 (110b), but further inspection of the note shows that the place of writing is Damascus. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley, Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyuddin 51, JMIAS, 40 (2006), pp. 101-116.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
724
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Amr al-muḥkam
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Haci Mahmud (ex-Yahya Ef) 2415, dated 1293H Ulu Cami 1590, 99b-110b, dated c. 1063H (based on other works in collection) Manisa 2964, 74a-90a, dated 1083H, Edirne (SH)
msAdditions
Carullah 986, 12e, 33b-34b, written by a disciple in lifetime of IA.
JC
MC
AAS
Root
CA
SH
JC
AK
MM
AP
Clark and McAuley, 2006: At the end, on 110b, there is a note saying that the book was completed in Damascus in Jumâdâ al-ûlâ 602 by the hand of its author […] Osman Yahia asserts that the text was completed in Konya in 602, based (he says) on evidence within the text.[21] We can only assume that this refers to three lines from the bottom on 95b: wa-laqad haddathanî Awhad al-dîn Hâmid ibn Abî l-Fakhr al-Kirmânî bi-manzilî fî madînat Qûniya fî shahr Safar sanat 602 (“Awhad al-dîn Kirmânî related to me in my home in the city of Konya in Safar 602 …”). [nb this note may refer to the date the work was copied, rather than composed]

K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib
كتاب عنقاء مغرب
RG №
30
Alt. RG №
xml:id
anqa
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib
كتاب عنقاء مغرب
موحد
Full
K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib fī maʿrifa khatm al-awliyāʾ wa shams al-maghrib
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
The Fabulous Gryphon
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers

ḥamidtu ilāhī wa-l-maqāmu ʿaẓīmu

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Almeria
مكان
Date
595
تاريخ
Earliest MS
597
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Written after a vision in 595H, this work is devoted to bringing out the role of the mahdī – the “rightly guided leader” – and the Seal of the Saints (whom he identifies with Jesus), discussing both a prophetic aspect which looks to the unfolding of their functions in time, and a mystical aspect which understands them as realities which can be realised in the heart of the complete human being.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by at least four historic mss. The best is Berlin Oct. 3266 (described by Gerald Elmore in Islamic Sainthood in the Fullness of Time (Leiden, 1999) pp. 197-199), which was written in 597H, and is the oldest known ms. of IA’s. Also excellent is Private 1, written in 637H by a well-known disciple, Muḥammad b. ʿAbd al-Qādir al-Anṣāri, in Damascus and checked against the original in IA’s hand; however, according to Abrar Ahmed Shahi, who has prepared a critical edition of the text, this mss contains only about 50% of the work. Another early copy, dated 707H in the Turkish catalogue (http://ktp.isam.org.tr/), is Veliyuddin 1743 ff.1-79. Another copy, dated 834H, in Milli Hk 15 ff.12b-43b, is available in digital reproduction here: https://www.yazmalar.gov.tr/detay_goster.php?k=77129 JC notes that most of the poems from ʿAnqāʾ mughrib are also found as a block – and as complete poems – in the Dīwān, p. 26-33.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
597
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. ʿAnqāʾ mughrib

منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2019). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Publications Cairo editions, 1373H (1954), 1997 and 1998. A commentary by M. Ibrah∆m M. Sålim, Kashf al-Gha†å⁄ ¡an Asrår al-¡Anqå¡, Cairo, 1999. (JC)
Trans GE as Islamic Sainthood and forthcoming edition.

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
Mss. Esad Ef, 1413. 1a-47a (not 37). An excellent vowelled copy, written by a disiple of SQ’s, Qasam [b.] MuΩaffar [b. ¡Asåkir], and probably copied from SQ’s copy. No date, but it must be pre-673/1274. (JC/SH) Shehit Ali 1340. 110a-150a is in fact an extract from Tadiråt al-ilåhiya (RG 716). Only 150a-153a is an extract from ¡Anqa⁄. This whole collection is dated 789H and was written by Abd al-Kar∆m b. Ab¬ Bakr al-Jabarti, who was the teacher of ¡Abd al-Karim al-J∆l∆. (JC/SH). Carullah 986 , 51b-60. Like GE (see Islamic Sainthood…, pp.199-200) we could find nothing which supports OY’s claim that it was copied by a disciple in the lifetime of IA. But GE ‘s assessment is that this is nevertheless an important copy, probably taken from the original. (JC/SH).
additions
Mss. Berlin 3266 (probably the oldest surviving ms. of a work by Ibn ‘Arab∆). Commentary on the Dibâja by Hasan b. Muhammad al- Hanafî al- Halabî, ms. BN. 2669, ff. 156-166. Publications Cairo editions, 1373H (1954), 1997 and 1998. A commentary by M. Ibrah∆m M. Sålim, Kashf al-Gha†å⁄ ¡an Asrår al-¡Anqå¡, Cairo, 1999. Translations Into English by G. Elmore as Islamic Sainthood in the Fullness of Time, Leiden, 1998. (MC)
msAdditions
Carullah 986, 12e, 51b-60, written by a disciple in lifetime of author.

R. al-Anwār (K. Asrār al-khalwa)
رسالة الأنوار (كتاب أسرار الخلوة)
RG №
33
Alt. RG №
xml:id
anwar
Title
عنوان
Uniform
R. al-Anwār (K. Asrār al-khalwa)
رسالة الأنوار (كتاب أسرار الخلوة)
موحد
Full
R. al-Anwār fi mā yumnaḥ ṣāhib al-khalwa min al-asrār
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي

al-ḥamdu li wāhib al-ʿaql wa-mubdiʿhi
حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Konya
مكان
Date
602
تاريخ
Earliest MS
651
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Written in answer to a request from a friend and companion that he should explain the journey of ascension to the ‘lord of power’ and the return to the creatures. It describes the spiritual quest in terms of a non-stop ascension through the various levels of existence and knowledge leading to the level of human perfection.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A very commonly copied work in the early collections, verified by at least four historic mss. The best is probably Yusuf Aga 7838, which is from the SQ’s library, with a samāʿ dated 651H in Aleppo in SQ’s hand. Often confused with another treatise on retreat, K. al-Khalwa (RG255) (as OY has done with Yusuf Aga 7838 copy). Other mss listed: Dar al-Kutub: dated 602H in collection 23 maj. (http://www.manuscripts.idsc.gov.eg/Manuscript/Manuscript_OPAC/Availability.aspx?ID=5323&ResID=1) and dated 600H is in collection 31 maj. (http://www.manuscripts.idsc.gov.eg/Manuscript/Manuscript_OPAC/Availability.aspx?ID=5544&ResID=8) - dating almost certainly drawn from dates in text not the date of composition.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
651
Library
Code

R. al-Anwār (K. Asrār al-khalwa)

منشورات
Editions
Radtke and O’Kane’s translation in New Critical Essays: On the Present State and Future Tasks of the Study of Sufism (Utrecht 2005) is a critical edition in transliteration Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, but not yet published. Critical edition by Dr Moreno Giannina completed but not yet published (2018)
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Rabia Terri-Harris Journey to the Lord of Power, New York, 1981 English, French and German translation by Bernd Radtke and John O’Kane: New Critical Essays: On the Present State and Future Tasks of the Study of Sufism, Utrecht, 2005 French translation by Othman Laiba and Roger Maridort: ‘Les Étapes Divines dans la voie du perfectionnment du règne human’ in Etudes Traditionelles, 1949, pp. 76-90. Italian translation by Angelo Iacovella, L’epistola dei settanta veli, Roma, 1997
Spanish translation by Pedro Aguado Saiz: Viaje al Senor del Poder, Malaga, 1986. German translation by Franz Langmayr: Reise zum Herrn der Macht, Zurich, 2007
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Publications Cairo 1986 Cairo n.d. Tehran, 1416H (in Raså⁄il Ibn ¡Arab∆) Beirut 1997 (in Raså¡il Ibn ¡Arab∆). The commentary attributed to Abd al-Karîm Jîlî is most probably not by him; on the subject, see the thesis of R. Atlagh, Contribution à l’étude de la pensée mystique d’Ibn Arabî et son école à travers l’œuvre de Abd al-Karî Jîlî, submitted at l’E.P.H.E., Paris, Décembre 2000. (MC)
Edited B. Radtke and trans O’Kane.

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
The commentary attributed to Abd al-Karîm Jîlî is most probably not by him; on the subject, see the thesis of R. Atlagh, Contribution à l’étude de la pensée mystique d’Ibn Arabî et son école à travers l’œuvre de Abd al-Karî Jîlî, submitted at l’E.P.H.E., Paris, Décembre 2000.
additions
Publications Cairo 1986 Cairo n.d. Tehran, 1416H (in Raså⁄il Ibn ¡Arab∆) Beirut 1997 (in Raså¡il Ibn ¡Arab∆). Trans lations Into Spanish (abridged) by Asin Palacios, El Islam cristianizado, Madrid, 1931, pp. 433- 449. Into English by Terri Harris, Journey to the Lord of Power, New York, 1981. Corr. Le commentaire attribué à Abd al-Karîm Jîlî n'est certainement pas de lui ; voir à ce sujet le thèse de R. Atlagh, Contribution à l'étude de la pensée mystique d'Ibn Arabî et son école à travers l'˛uvre de Abd al-Karî Jîlî, soutenue à l'E.P.H.E., Paris, Décembre 2000. (MC) title: R. al-Anwar Veliyuddin 1686, 21b-26b According to OY read before SQ in 667. No actual date on the copy, but later in book same scribe notes that he copied the Mahasin al-majalis of Abu'l-'Abbas Ibn al-'Arif in Sha'ban 667H, bi-manzili mawlana wa-shaykhina wa-imamina wa-quda'ina ila-llah subhanahu. Probable that this is SQ but no definitive evidence. He also copied work by Sa'd al-din Hamuya, referring to him as deceased and as sayyidina, and then quoting comment by SQ on the work. Milli Yz A 571, 189b-196a Dated 668H in Konya Ayasofya 2063 Dated 703H in Damascus, copied from an original in the hand of IA Shehit Ali 1341, 70a-75b Dated 724H in Damascus, but no evidence of having been copied from an original (as OY suggests) Carulla 986 OY says this ms was written during lifetime of IA, but there is no evidence to suggest anything like this - the format and style on the contrary suggest a later date. Carulla 2111 Dated 915H in Damascus, no evidence of having been copied from an original (as OY suggests) Shehit Ali 2717, 26b-32b Dated 977H in Mecca, complete Hudayi 517 Dated 999H in Hudayi's hand Manisa 2964, 61-67a Dated 1083H in Edirne title: K. Asrar al-khalwa Yusuf Aga 7838, 44a-53b, (classified by OY as RG 255) dated 651H, checked with original, from SQ's library Sama on 44a in SQ’s hand: This treatise was read in the house of M. Ibn Sawdakin on 1st Ramadan 651H by Muhamad b. Ishaq. b. Muhammad (=SQ) Marginal corrections throughout. 53b in SQ’s hand: checked and corrected against the shaykh’s own copy. Manisa 2989, 121a-132b, n.d. From SH
msAdditions
Veliyuddin 1826, 5-11b, eao, carries a sema⁄ dated 621H

K. al-Aqṭāb
كتاب الأقطاب
RG №
35
Alt. RG №
135
xml:id
aqtab

al-Yathribī alladhī lā naʿta yaḍbiṭuhu

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638?
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The function, states and places of the saints who have the spiritual rank of the ‘pole’ (quṭb). This is a series of chapters on the aqṭāb which became part of the FM chapters 462-489, with poems up to 557 (corresponding to sifr 17 of 20 in the first recension).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists only one ms, Koprulu 766, 1-146, which is an early text. It carries no date, but evidence suggests that it may date to late 7th century (the scribe is the same as that of Farghānī’s Muntahā al-madārik listed here http://41.32.191.214/cgi-bin/koha/opac-detail.pl?biblionumber=39750, dated 704H). We have found a second text in the Ulu Cami library in Bursa, but as we have not yet obtained a digital copy, cannot compare the two mss. JC notes discrepancy between the text and the added red numbers from ch. 4 onwards: from chapter “five” to chapter “sixteen” the red ink number (467-478) is one less than the corresponding FM chapter number (ch.468-479); from chapter “seventeen” to “sixty” the red ink number (479-522) is four less than the corresponding FM chapter number (ch.483-526); from chapter “sixty-one” to “ninety-one” (the last in the ms) there are no red ink numbers – and these correspond to FM ch.527-557. In summary, the text of RG 35 K. al-Aqṭāb has the appearance of a highly abbreviated version of FM ch.462-557, omitting ch.480-482 entirely. It is possible that RG 35 is an early form or summary of sifr 17 of the first recension text of FM.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638?
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Aqṭāb
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Other
Reference in other work(s)

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions



إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Mss. Koprulu 766, undated but written in the lifetime of IA by Muhammad b. Abdallah al-Tamimi al-Mahdawi Similar to Chapters 462-553 in Futuhat, but clearly an earlier version, with less elaboration and poetry. A close comparison of the handwriting shows that Tamimi is also the scribe for the texts of (stolen) Yusuf Aga 4868, which OY and others have ascribed to IA (eg Hilyat al-abdal) From SH
msAdditions

Related Item: FM ch. 462-479 and ch. 483-557 (or sifr 17 of first recsension of FM) (see biblio comments)

R. [fī] al-Arwāḥ
رسالة في الأرواح

TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the angelic spirits and their different categories (lost in love/muhayyama, organising the heavens/musakhkhira, and organising bodies/mudabbira). Similar in content to Fut.III.201, where the same categories of spirits are discussed (ch. 348).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one ms, Zahiriye 5433/241b-242b. It is styled as a separate treatise, but may be either K. al-Arwāḥ (mentioned in Fihrist) or drawn from passages in the Futuhat.

TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A set of letter poems found in the last section of University A79 (fols. 98a-102a), which should not be regarded as duplicate of RG 380 (which is not extant).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
According to OY, at least two of the five surviving mss – Ulu Cami 1600 and Halet 812 – are the treatise appended to the end of the Rūḥ al-Quds (University A79). This is also the case with Berlin 2992. OY says that British Museum 754/4e 90-96 is a different text but we have not yet checked. Same title given for (Damascus) Zahiriyah 6824.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
Library
Code
Pag-es
Asrār ḥurūf al-muʿjam
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

موحد

كامل
Variant
Kitab al-awrâd al-yawmiyya: Al-awr^rad al-akbariyya: Awrâd al-ayyâm wa-l-layâli: Magmu ‘at al-ahyâli: Al- Awrad wa-l-ahzâb: Awrad; Awrâd ubsû ‘iyya.
بديل
English
Weekly prayers
إنجليزي

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
939
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A collection of fourteen prayers, one for each night and day of the week. For a detailed structure and analysis of the prayers, see Pablo Beneito and Stephen Hirtenstein Seven Days of the Heart (Oxford, 2000), with critical edition as Prayers for the Week (Oxford, 2021).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There are no historic mss. and all the surviving texts are late, though always attributed to IA. The earliest dated copy is Carullah 1094 (939H), but Veliyuddin 1833 may be older. According to Stephen Hirtenstein and Pablo Beneito it is authentic on textual grounds, and the lack of early copies is attributed to the work being only copied for close disciples, not open diffusion. There is another relatively early manuscript of Evradü’l-Eyyami’s-Seb’a (dated 949H or 950H) in Topkapi E.H. 1072 with 42 folios according to the online catalogue at https://topkapisarayi.gov.tr/en/manuscripts
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
939
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Awrād al-usbūʿ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

منشورات
Editions
The Arabic text and transliteration published by Muhyiddin Ibn ‘Arabī Society (Oxford, 1979) is based upon one manuscript only. Arabic text and transliteration by Pablo Beneito and Stephen Hirtenstein in Prayers for the Week, Oxford, 2021.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Pablo Beneito and Stephen Hirtenstein: The Seven Days of the Heart (Oxford, 2000), based upon seven manuscripts and two printed editions. Republished in new edition as Prayers for the Week (Oxford, 2020).
Portugese translation by Pablo Beneito: Os Sete Dias do Coroçāo, Brazil, 2014

نطاق زمني
Before 603H
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
On the symbolism of the days of the week, time and cosmology.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least three historic mss. The best is Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph dated 603H, with two samāʿ in the presence of IA dated 603H and 633H, which was the riwāya copy of Ibn Sawdakīn.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
603
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Ayyām al-shaʾn

K. al-Azal
كتاب الأزل
RG №
68

azal
Title

K. al-Azal
كتاب الأزل
موحد
Full
Risâlat al Azal: Kitab thamânin wa thalâthin.
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-dāʾim alladhī lam yuzal
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba

Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
615
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
On the meaning of the term azal (eternity) in the predecessors of IA such as al-Hallāj and al-Sulamī. The alternative title (K. al-thamānīn wa thalāthīn = 38) refers to the abjad total of the word azal.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by at least five historic mss. The holograph Yusuf Aga 4868 was written in 615H in Malatya, and Carullah 2111 is copied from an original which was read before IA. According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that no place or date is given. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
615
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Azal
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Konya
مكان

602
تاريخ
Earliest MS
617
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Holograph copy, with samāʿ 617H in Aleppo (Veliyuddin 1759)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
According to Michel Chodkiewicz, this is an esoteric commentary upon the Fātiḥa which completes Chapter 383 of FM which, in the series of ‘waystations’ (manāzil), corresponds to the waystation of the Fātiha.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least five historic mss. The best is Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph with two samāʿs in the presence of IA, one dated 617H in Aleppo, the other dated 627H (Damascus). The title on Beyazit 3750 (253b) says that the work is one of the manāzil in FM; we have checked against the holograph and it is identical. Perhaps needs some further checking (see OY’s comment on p.179).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
617
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-ʿAẓama
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

corrections
additions
Corr. A l'examen, il apparaît qu'il s'agit d'un commentaire ésotérique de la Fatiha, et qu'il complète le chapitre 383 des Futûhât qui, dans la série des manâzil, correspond au manzil de la Fâtiha. (MC)

Carullah 986/82-84b, written by a disciple

ba

Book of the Ba
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
saʾalanī man taʿizz ʿalayya masʾalatuhu wa-tanjah ladayya ṭilbatuhu… al-ḥamdu lillāh billāh fa-innahu athbata li-ʿaynī wa-abqā li-kawnī

Verification

درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
>599H (date of vision in Bijaya), ca. 601-2H in Malatya or Damascus (holograph Yusuf Aga 4868)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the symbolism of the letter bāʾ, the first manifestation of being and the intermediary between the One and the many. Ibn ‘Arabi says in his preface that he wrote it at the request of one of his disciples, who had asked him to write a work on the Divine Realities, based on a spiritual address he had received regarding the bāʾ.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least four historic mss. The best is the holograph Yusuf Aga 4868 (undated). The second is Veliyuddin 51, dated 762H, copied from an original in the hand of the author, possibly YA 4868? According to OY, the work was written in 602H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that no place or date is given. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Bāʾ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Fanāʾ fī al-mushāhada
كتاب الفناء في المشاهدة
RG №
125
Alt. RG №
xml:id
dana
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Fanāʾ fī al-mushāhada
كتاب الفناء في المشاهدة
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
Al-ginâ fi-l musâhadât
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qaddara wa-qaḍā wa-hakam
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba

ختام النص

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Baghdad
مكان
Date
?
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<700
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
An extended meditation upon Surat al-Bayyina (Q 98) describing the experience of mystical vision and the difference between people of real knowledge and people of intellect.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 33 mss., of which four can be considered historic, although none is definitive. The note on NO 2406 cannot be regarded as completely reliable, and the text in Shehit Ali 1375 is dated at 722H only on the basis of other works in the collection. But the work appears in other very good collections, such as Carullah 986 and Beyazit 3750, and has been very widely copied. It is also mentioned in the FM, and there is internal evidence of authenticity in the text.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<700
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Fanāʾ fī al-mushāhada
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Italian translation by Younis Tawfik and Roberto Rossi Testa, Il libro dell’estinzione nella contemplazione, Milano, 1996
Spanish translation by Andrés Guijarro: El libro de la extinción en la contemplación, Malaga, 2007. Italian translation by Michel Valsan: Il libro dell'estinzione nella contemplazione, Milan, 1996.

Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentary by IA himself on his cycle of love poetry, Tarjumān al-Ashwāq (RG 767), bringing out the esoteric meaning of the verses. As IA explains in the preface, he wrote it at the request of Badr al-Ḥabashī and Ibn Sawdakīn in Aleppo in 611H because it had incited the disapproval of some of the local ʿulamāʾ.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by two historic mss., Evkaf Muzesi 1713 (873H) and Fatih 5322 (934H), which are both copied from originals written by Ayyūb b. Badr, with samāʿ dated 626H and 616H resp. Most mss. also include the full text of the Tarjuman (RG 767), of which there are also some separate copies. Copy in Baghdad, Iraq Museum 11086/2 which a cataloguer believed was copied in the 7th century (al-Furqān online: https://www.al-furqan.com/our_is_item/manid/1250158/groupid/139348) See: مخطوطات الأدب في المتحف العراقي = Makhṭūṭāt al-adab fī al-Matḥaf al-ʿIrāqī = Catalogue of Manuscripts of Literature In the Iraq Museum Library, p.444 (#1155). After transcribing the usual text in which IA gives the reason he wrote the work the catalogue has this: فرغ منه المؤلف سنة 614H بمدرسة الامير مظفر الدين محمود This information does not occur in most mss: completed 614H in the madrasah of Amīr Muẓaffar al-dīn Maḥmūd. (It occurs in the Shuqayrī edition of 1995).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
640
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Dhakhāʾir wa-l-aʿlāq

Publications
منشورات
Editions
The 1911 translation of Tarjumān al-ashwāq by Nicholson (London, 1911) contains a critical edition of the poems and the introduction, but not of the commentary. Critical edition by Dr Muḥammed ʿAlam al-Dīn al-Shuqayrī (Cairo, 1995) Critical edition and German translation in preparation by Georg Bossong of the University of Zurich.
طبعات
Translations
Partially translated into English by R H Nicholson alongside his translation of the poems in The Tarjumān al-ashwāq, London, 1911. Fully translated into French by Maurice Gloton alongside his translation of the poems in L’interprète des désirs, Paris, 1996.

al-Dīwān al-kabīr

توثيق
Note on Authenticity

634H
تاريخ

634
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Ibn ʿArabi’s collected poems, containing more than 800 verses, compiled in the last years of his life and finished in 634H. There are are several different versions of the work, including a six volume holograph of which we do not, at the moment, have a complete copy. Research is therefore ongoing to produce a definitive version of the whole text. The best-known version is the printed edition produced by Bulaq, which only reproduces one volume. An analysis of the different versions can be found in Cook/Hirtenstein: The Great Diwān and its offspring; the collection and dispersion of Ibn ʿArabī’s poetry, in JMIAS 52, 2012.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 28 mss, of which at least four are historic. The best is Khalili 225, which is volume (juzʾ) 4 of the holograph, dated 634H in Damascus. The other holographs, Yusuf Aga 5502 and 5503, were stolen without being previously microfilmed, so there is no access to the texts, although it is believed that Uni 1438 is a copy of the first part.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A list by Ibn ʿArabi himself of his works, consisting of 248 different titles. It was written before 627H (see Hamidiye 188), therefore does not include later works. Critical edition by Bakri Aladdin 2020
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 13 mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Aga 7838, written by SQ probably during lifetime of IA, although it may be incomplete. Hamidiye 188 is a copy of this original with added works dated 627H and 628H, with a samāʿ given by IA. The same is true of Majāmiʿ 340.

The Bezels of Wisdom, the Wisdom of the Prophets
إنجليزي

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف

Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
627H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
630
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The most famous and widely read of all Ibn ʿArabī’s works, containing the epitome of his teachings on the meaning of the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil). It takes the form of 27 chapters on the prophets from Adam to Muhammad, each associated with a knowledge; for example; the wisdom on divinity in the word of Adam: the wisdom of light in the word of Joseph. Ibn ʿArabī’s intention in the Fuṣūṣ is to draw out the interior, saintly wisdom of each prophet rather than the religious law which they brought.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied and commented on work, verified by at least seven historic mss. The best is Evkaf Muzesi 1933, which is SQ’s riwāya. written in his hand in 630H, with two samāʿ in IA’s hand. Other early mss: Kastamonu Hk 2024 (710H), Paris 1340 (726H), Corum Hk 3909 (728H), Konya Ak 308 (757H)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
630
Library
Code
Pag-es
Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

مصنفات ذات الصلة

Note on Related Works

194
Reference to work in the Ijāza
الإجازة

187
Reference to work in the Fihrist
الفهرست

References to work in Futūḥāt

Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Beirut edition edited by Abu ʿAlā ʿAfīfī (Beirut, nd) is based upon several mss. but did not use the Ṣādr al-dīn al-Qūnawī autograph (Evkaf Musezi 1933). A new critical edition using the Qūnawī autograph, plus a translation into Urdu, by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb (with Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī) (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive. A critical edition alongside Naqsh al-Fuṣūṣ, with complete references to Qurʾān and ḥadith by Dr Saiyad Nizamuddin al-Husayni (Cairo, date unknown). Critical edition by Mahmud Kiliç and Abdurrahim Alkiṣ (Istanbul 2016), fully vowelled based upon al-Kashānī’s commentary plus a facsmile of the oldest ms, Evkaf Muzesi 1933, written by Ṣadr al-dīn al-Qūnawi.
طبعات
Translations
English Partial translation (12 chapters only) by Angela Culme-Seymour, based upon Burckhardt’s French translation: The Wisdom of the Prophets, Glos, 1975. Full translation by ʿAisha ʿAbd al-Rahman at-Tarjumana: The Seals of Wisdom, Norwich, 1980. Full translation by R W J Austin: The Bezels of Wisdom, New York, 1981. Full rendering alongside the commentary by ʿAbd Allah Bosnawī by Bulent Rauf: Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam, Vols 1-4, Oxford, 1981-6: Second Edition, 1994. Full translation by Caner K Dagli: The Ringstones of Wisdom, Chicago, 2004. Full translation by Binyamin Abrahmov, Ibn al-ʿArabi’s Fusus al-hikam, London, 2015. French Partial translation (12 chapters only) by Titus Burckhardt: La Sagesse des Prophètes, Paris, 1974. Full translation by Charles-André Gilis: Le Livre des Chatons des Sagesse, Vols 1 & 2, Paris, 1998. Full translation by Paul Ballanfat: Les Chatons des sagesses et les demeures des paroles (Combes, 2020) Italian Italian translation by Titus Burckhardt, La sapienza dei Profeti, Roma, 1987 (partial translation: only 12 chapters)
German Full translation by Hans Kofler:Fuṣūṣ al-Ḥikam, Graz (Austria), 1970. Partial translation based upon Burkhardt: Die Weisheit der propheten, Zurich, 2001. Partial translation by Alma Geise: Ibn ʿArabī: Urwolke und Welt, Munich 2002. Spanish Full translation by Abderramán Mohamed Maanán: Los Engarces de la sabiduría, Madrid, 1994. Full translation by Andrés Guijarro: Los engarces de las sabidurías, Madrid, 2009. Italian Partial translation by Giorgio Jannaccone; Titus Burckhardt: La sapienza dei profeti , Rome, 1987. Serbo-Croat Full translation by Resid Hafizovic: Dragulji Poslanicke Mudrosti Fuṣūs al-Ḥikam, Zenica, 1995.

The Wisdom of the Prophets, Titus Burckhardt, Angela Culme-Seymour. 12 chapters only. Beshara Publications, 1975
إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Add. Cette rubrique, comme celle de RG. 135 (= Futûhât makkiyya) est l'une des plus importantes du Répertoire Général et sa mise à jour requiert la collaboration de tous les scholars travaillant sur Ibn Arabî. Je me borne pour l'instant à noter quelques addenda correspondant aux informations que j'ai sous la main. Traductions -Espagne : Los engarces de la sabiduria, par Abderramàn Mohamed Maanàn, Madrid, 1991. -Allemagne : Das Buch der Siegelringsteine der Weisheitssprüche par Hans Kofler, Graz, 1970. -Angleterre :The Seals of Wisdom par 'A'isha 'Abd al-Rahmân al-Tarjumana, Norwich, 1980. The Bezels of Wisdom, par R.W. J. Austin, London, 1980. -France : Les Chatons de la Sagesse, par Ch. A. Gilis, Beyrouth, 1997 Commentaires : plusieurs de ceux que mentionne O.Y. ont été depuis publiés. Une première investigation rapide me fournit la liste suivante : n°3 Qûnawî, Fukûk, Téhéran, 1413h. n°5 Jandî (ed. Ashtiyânî), Mashhad, 1982 n°13 Qaysarî (ed. Ashtiyânî) Téhéran, 1375. n°18 Amôlî, Nass al-nusûs, (muqaddima) (ed. H. Corbin/O.Y), Paris.Téhéran, 1975. n°21 Sâ'în al-Dîn Turka (2 vols), Téhéran, 1420 h. n° 24 Jâmî, Naqd al-nusûs, Téhéran, 1977 (ed. Chittick) n° 57 Muhammad Pârsâ, Téhéran 1406h.

al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya

135

futuhat

عنوان
Uniform
al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya
الفتوحات المكية
موحد
Full
Al-Futūḥāt al- Makkiya fī maʿrifat al-asrār al-mālikiyya wa-l-mulkiyya
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
Revelations of Mecca
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lilāh alladhī awjad al-ashiyāʾ ʿan ʿadam wa-ʿadamahu wa-awqaf wajūdahā ʿalā tuwajjah kalimihi li-nataḥaqqaq bidhālik sir ḥudūthhā wa-qidamahā min qidamahi
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
629/636
تاريخ
Earliest MS
636
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Ibn ʿArabī’s great summary of esoteric knowledge, consisting of 560 chapters and extending to nearly 10,000 pages in the holograph. It totalises all aspects of his work and all the esoteric knowledge of his era. The first recension, completed in Ṣafar 629H, exists only in copies, while the second, written between 632H and 636H, survives in IA’s own hand (see Evkaf Muzesi 1845+). There is still work to be done in distinguishing between the two recensions in the mss base, but considerable progress has been made by Julian Cook and Claude Addas in identifying “markers” which indicate the recension of any given ms. Their research indicates that many later mss. may be hybrids of the two recensions. For details of their work on the two recensions, see ancillary documents.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by many mss. in both recensions. The best of the second recension is Evkaf Muzesi 1845+ in 37 volumes, which is the original in IA’s hand, written in 636H and carrying over 71 samāʿ.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
636
Library
Code
Pag-es
al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
relation
Note on Related Works
Cross-references
إحالات مزدوجة
To this work
إلى هذا المصنف
Ijāza
50
Reference to work in the Ijāza
الإجازة
Fihrist
50
Reference to work in the Fihrist
الفهرست
Futūḥāt
References to work in Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Two critical editions exist. The first, edited by Osman Yahia (Cairo, 1970+) consists of 14 volumes and is incomplete. The second , edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb (Yemen, 2011) is in 12 volumes and is complete. It is largely based upon the Konya autograph – the manuscript of the second recension of the book written in 37 sections by Ibn ʿArabī himself – but also takes into account other texts. Critical edition of the poems on the letters in chapter 2 by Maurizio Marconi in Azufre Rojo vo. 7 (2020).
طبعات
Translations
There is as yet no complete translation of the Futūḥāt. Eric Winkel is working on one, and information on how to access his translation can be found on http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/infopdf/futuhat-winkel-announcement.pdf. and https://www.createspace.com/pub/simplesitesearch.search.do?sitesearch_query=Eric+A.+Winkel&sitesearch_type=STORE. In addition, there are very many partial translations. The following list includes only a few of the more substantial ones. English Eric Winkel, The Openings Revealed at Mecca (New York, 2018– ) William Chittick The Sufi Path of Knowledge, New York, 1981. (Substantial sections of translation from many chapters) William Chittick, The Self-Disclosure of God, New York, 1998. (Substantial sections of translation from many chapters) James W Morris: ‘How to study the Futūḥāt; Ibn ʿArabī’s own advice’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), Oxford, 1993 (Introduction) William Chittick: ‘Two chapters from the Futūḥāt ’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), Oxford, 1993 (Chapters 317 and 339) William Chittick: Imaginal Worlds, New York, 1994 (Chapter 66) Eric Winkel: Mysteries of Purity, Indiana, 1995 (Chapter 68) Michel Chodkiewicz, William Chittick, James W Morris, Denis Gril: The Meccan Revelations,Vols 1 & 2 New York, 2002, 2004 (Selections from 19 chapters, based upon the French edition of 1988) Aisha Bewley: The Mysteries of Bearing Witness, Chicago, 2002 (Selections from 1, 50, 67, 560) Gracia Lopez Anguita: ‘On the Inner Knowledge of Spirits Made of an Igneous Mixture: Chapter 9 of Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya’, JMIAS, 44, 2008 pp. 1-24 Aisha Bewley: Ibn ʿArabī on the Mysteries of the Purifying Alms, no place, 2009. ( Chaper 70) Aisha Bewley: Ibn ʿArabī on the Mysteries of the Pilgrimage, no place, 2009. (Chapter 72) Stephen Hirtenstein, The Alchemy of Human Happiness, Oxford 2017 (chapter 167) French Stephane Ruspoli:L’Alchimie du Bonheur Parfait, Paris, 1981. (Chapter 167) Charles-André Gilis: Le Coran et la fonction d’Hermès, Paris 1984 (Section 10 of Chapter 198), republished in 1998 under the title: Les Trente-six Attestations Coraniques de l’Unité. Maurice Gloton: Traité de l’Amour, Paris, 1986. (Chapter 178 on love) Michel Chodkiewicz, William Chittick, James W Morris, Denis Gril: Les Illuminations de la Mecque, Paris, 1988. (Selections from 19 chapters) Charles-André Gilis: Textes sur le Jeüne, Beirut, 1998. (Chapter 71) Charles-André Gilis: Le prière du jour du vendredi, Paris, 1994. (Chaper 69) Moreno Giannini: Le Voyage Spirituel, Louvain-la-Neuve, 1995. (Chapter 367) Michel Valsan: ‘al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyyah: Chapter 172 on the Knowledge of the Station of Tawḥīd’, Science Sacrée, 7, 2005. pp. 46-58. (First part only). A Penot: Les Révelations de la Mecque, Paris, 2009. (Partial translations of Chapters 1-55 on cosmology) Maurice Gloton: De la mort à la résurrection : chapitres 61 à 65 des Ouvertures spirituelles mekkoises, Beirut 2009; Paris 2009. Italian ʿAbdul-Hadi Agueli, “El-Akbariya”, Il Convito, Cairo (Egypt), 1907, pp. 48-50 (Chapter 401) Massimo Jevolella, L’alchimia della felicità, Como, 1996 (Chapter 167) Placido Fontanesi “Prologo del libro”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1997, (Khutbah) Placido Fontanesi, “Introduzione”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1998, pp. 22-56 (First part of Introduction) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza degli uomini dello sconcerto”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1980, pp. 71-85 (Chapter 50) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza dei pensieri satanici che affiorano alla coscienza”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1983, pp. 17-32 (Chapter 55) Placido Fontanesi, “Il pentimento” Rivista di studi tradizionali, 2003, pp. 205-231 (Chapter 74) Placido Fontanesi, “Lo scrupolo ed i suoi segreti”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1986, pp. 142-153 (Chapter 91) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza della stazione spirituale dell’abbandono dello scrupolo”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1986, pp. 154-158 (Chapter 92) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza della povertà e dei suoi segreti”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1985, pp. 11-22 (Chapter 162) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza della volontà”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1986, pp. 82-97 (Chapter 226) Placido Fontanesi, “La conoscenza della nafs”, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1984, pp. 7-16 (Chapter 267) Maurizio Marconi, ‘Testi deel al-Futuhat al-Makkiyya’, Azufre Rojo 7 (2020) Maurizio Marconi, ‘Capitolo 2 di al-Futuhat al-Makkiyya’ in Azufre Rojo vol. 10 (2022)
German Wolfgang Herrman: Abhandlung Ẓber die Liebe, Zurich, 2009 (Chapter 178).
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add La mise à jour de cette rubrique du RG. demandera un certain temps et réclamera le concours de tous les spécialistes. Elle devra, en effet, non seulement signaler les éditions postérieures (à commencer par l'édition critique entreprise par O.Y. lui-même) mais aussi recenser, aussi exhaustivement que possible: 1) les traductions partielles en diverses langues 2) les commentaires (par ex. ceux dont W. Chittick a signalé les mss. dans son article "Notes on Ibn Arabî's influence in the Subcontinent", in The Muslim World, vol. LXXXII, n° 3-4, 1992, pp. 218-241). (MC)


إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
RG 135 Al -Fath al-makkî Add La mise à jour de cette rubrique du RG. demandera un certain temps et réclamera le concours de tous les spécialistes. Elle devra, en effet, non seulement signaler les éditions postérieures (à commencer par l'édition critique entreprise par O.Y. lui-même) mais aussi recenser, aussi exhaustivement que possible: 1) les traductions partielles en diverses langues 2) les commentaires (par ex. ceux dont W. Chittick a signalé les mss. dans son article "Notes on Ibn Arabî's influence in the Subcontinent", in The Muslim World, vol. LXXXII, n° 3-4, 1992, pp. 218-241). Que tous ceux qui détiennent des informations propres à enrichir cette rubrique qui est évidemment l'une des plus importantes du R.G. veuillent bien les faire parvenir à Jane Clark.

Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the real being.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 35 mss. of which at least five can be considered historic. The best are Shehit Ali 2813 which was written by Ayyūb b. Badr in 621H in Damascus, and read in front of IA, and Private 1, copied during IA’s lifetime.

درجة الصحة

توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Ṭāʾif
مكان
Date
599
تاريخ
Earliest MS
602
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Holograph copy 7th Rabiʿ al-awwal 602H in Malatya (Yusuf Ağa 4868)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the four essentials of the Way – silence, seclusion, hunger and wakefulness – as the means to the attainment of the spiritual station of the Substitutes (al-abdāl).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work originally written in Tāʾif in 599H, verified by seven historic mss. The best is the holograph Yusuf Ağa 4868, written in Malatya in 602H. See S. Hirtenstein ed. and trans., Four Pillars of Spiritual Transformation (Anqa, 2008). Other mss to check (JC): KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 176-180 (602H?); Murad Buhari 324 (f.96-103 (681H?); Ayasofya 2910 (706H?)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
602
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ḥilyat al-abdāl
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition published by S. Hirtenstein alongside the English translation in Four Pillars of Spiritual Transformation (Anqa, 2008). Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Stephen Hirtenstein: Four Pillars of Spiritual Transformation, Oxford, 2008. French translation by Michel Valsan: La Parure des Abdāl, Paris, 1992.
Spanish translation in Textos epirituales [i.e. espirituales], Madrid 2004.
تراجم

أبحاث
Additions

Translated into French by Valsan and into English by SH. Edition in progress (SH)

corrections

msAdditions
JC
MC
AAS
Root
CA
SH
JC
AK
MM
AP
Dating: note exact date in composition See Jane and Denis (vel.51): The title is given on 132a and the text itself starts on 132b. At the end, on 136a, there is a note saying that it was copied in 762 in the hand of Ahmad b. M. b. Muthabbit, who took it from the handwriting of the author, who said at the end of the book that he had composed it in Malatya, in Anatolia, on the 9th of Rabî’ al-awwal 602 [AP: Yusuf Agha has 9]. Osman Yahia does not mention this note, although he correctly lists the text as having been copied from an original. The date exactly agrees with that on Yusuf Aga 4868, which is the best copy of the text.[24] But it is not the actual date of composition of the work, which is given in the preface as 599 in Mecca.[25] This opens up the intriguing possibility that Yusuf Aga 4868 was the original from which Ahmad copied this version of Hilyat, although a comparison of the two collections as a whole does not throw up any further obvious correlations. AP: this also raises the possibility that Ibn Muthabbit is given the dates these works were originally copied NOT originally composed... raises an issue.
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library

Ḥizb al-aḥadiyya

TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Prayer similar in style to the Awrād (RG 64).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
This work is also known by various names, e.g. Ḥizb al-ʿārif billāh, often occurring with copies of the Awrād (RG 64). All extant copies are post-1000H. There is nothing to substantiate authenticity, and Stephen Hirtenstein, who has examined the mss., all of which are attributed to IA, believes that the internal evidence is fair. To check: Escurial, reference 132 6/417
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
1010
Library

Ḥizb al-aḥadiyya

994
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A short prayer of protection, widely circulated. Commonly known also as al-Dawr al-aʿlā or Dawr al-aʿlā. OY lists nine separate commentaries, which appear to have been written in 12–13th centuries.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There are many mss., all attributed to IA, though none can be considered historic. The earliest dated copy is 994H. Suha Taji-Farouki, who has produced the critical edition, (see below) is convinced of its authenticity on the basis of textual analyis, and chains of transmission on various mss. Published as Prayer for Spiritual Elevation and Protection (Oxford 2006).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
994
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ḥizb al-wiqāya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition: Prayer for Spiritual Elevation and Protection (ʿAnqa Publishing, Oxford 2006) by Suha Taji-Faroukī is a fully vowelled critical edition based upon nine manuscripts, plus a translation into English.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Suha Taji-Farouki, Prayer for Spiritual Elevation and Protection, Oxford 2006.

Note on Textual Identifiers

درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف

Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
761
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The symbolism of the personal pronoun ‘He’ (huwā), represented, in the order of the alphabet, by the last letter, yāʾ.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 26 mss., of which three are historic. The best are Veliyuddin 51, 762H(c), copied from an original in the hand of IA, and Yusuf Ağa 7838 which is undated, but from SQ’s library so presumed before 673H. According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, no place or date is given. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
761
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Hū
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

مصنفات ذات الصلة

طبعات

أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the veils of the heart which prevent the student from making progress in spiritual realisation.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A commonly copied text, verified by at least five historic mss. The best are Yusuf Ağa 7838, from SQ’s library, Milli 571 and University A4408 dated 748H and checked against an original in IA’s hand. It also appears in good collections such as Carullah 986, Beyazid 3750 and Shehit Ali 1351.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
668
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Ḥujub
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan), ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, in Rasāʾil Ibn al-Arabi (Volume 1). Another version is in progress by Andrea Hobright, an independant scholar working in USA under the supervision of William Chittick.
طبعات
Translations

Italian translation by Angelo Iacovella: L’epistola dei settanta veli, Rome, 1997.

K. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda
كتاب الإفادة لمن أراد الإستفادة
RG №
266
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ifada
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda
كتاب الإفادة لمن أراد الإستفادة
موحد
Full
K. al-Ifāda liman arāda al-istifāda
كامل

haḍrat ummahāt al-maʿārif

Earliest MS
664
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the different modes of knowledge.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites seven mss., and the text is verified by one historic ms., Manisa 1183 (664H taken from an original in IA’s hand) which he did not see. OY erroneously lists Fatih 5322 as having an authenticating samāʿ, but this refers to the next work in the collection, K. Maqṣid al-asmāʿ. According to OY, the same work, entitled Ummuhāt al-maʿārif has been attributed to Abd al-Karīm al-Jīlī, and the author mentions the Fuṣūṣ in the text. According to Pablo Beneito, Abū Tālib al-Makkī and Ibn Sīd al-Baṭalyawsī are also mentioned in the text.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
664

Code

K. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda

Ijāz al-bayān fī tarjama ʿan al-Qurʾān
إجاز البيان في ترجمة عن القرآن

268

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī

درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
622
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentary on the Qurʾan up to verse 253 of sura 2. Text cites K. Abkār al-afkār by Sayf al-dīn al-Āmidī (d. 631H in Damascus).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
We have found two mss, Dügümlü Baba 9 (which has no attribution on it and no date) and Dar al-kutub 1096 tafsīr, which copies IA’s colophon and was copied in 1302H. Abrar Ahmed of the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation in Lahore has found the original copy in IA’s hand in Bayt Jamīl in Baghdad. The title is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269), and in FM 3:64. Printed by Ghurab as Raḥma min al-Raḥmān (Damascus, 1979/1401).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
622
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ijāz al-bayān fī tarjama ʿan al-Qurʾān
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

629
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A list of 44 works which Qūnawī read with IA over a 2-3 year period, signed by him and licensing Qūnawī to transmit the teachings. See the translation of this work by Gerald Elmore, ‘Sadr al-Dīn al-Qûnawī's Personal Study-List of Books by Ibn al-'Arabī’, in Near Eastern Studies, Vol.56, n°7, July 1997, pp. 161-181.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by one definitive historic ms., Yusuf Ağa 7838 in which SQ lists the works that he studied with IA, with dates, followed by certifications in IA’s hand.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary

Code
Pag-es
Ijāzat al-shaykh al-akbar

Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar
إجازة للملك المظفر

269

موحد

كامل

aqūl wa-anā Muḥammad b. ʿAlī b. ʿArabī al-Ḥāṭimī wa-hādhā lafẓī/khaṭṭī

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
627
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<800
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A bibliography written by IA in which he lists 260 (+) of his works and 70 of his teachers. It was written for a sultan, variously known as al-Muẓaffar or al-Muʿaẓẓam Bahāʾ al-Dīn or Shihāb al-Dīn Ghāzī b. al-Malik al-ʿĀdil, in 632H in Damascus.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 16 mss, although none can be considered historic. There are several ‘families’: one is represented by Koprulu 766 (dated by TRF as 632H but we have not been able to find evidence for this); another by Princeton Garrett 4098 (dated 949H) and Zahiriyya 4679 (dated 1305); and the third by Badawi’s edition (and other printed editions). There is also a hybrid, Shehit Ali 2796 (undated), connected to the library of M. b. Qayṣar who was the head of SQ’s zāwiya. The principal factor in verifying this text as by IA is textual, i.e. its correspondence with Fihris muʿallafāt (RG142) and the corpus of known IA works.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<800
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add Edition par S. 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995, dans le volume qui contient le K. manzil al-manâzil al-fahwâniyya (RG 412), d'après des mss. très tardifs de Dâr al-kutub. S. 'Abd al-Fattâh compare ce texte à celui édité par 'Afîfî (Revue de la Faculté des Lettres de l'Université d'Alexandrie, VIII, 1964) en pensant qu'il s'agit de deux versions d'un même ouvrage alors que le texte édité par 'Afîfî est le Fihris (RG 142) et non l'Ijâza (qui a été édité par 'Abd al-Rahmân Badawî dans Al -Andalus, vol. XX, fasc.1, 1955). (MC)


إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Add Edition par S. 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995, dans le volume qui contient le K. manzil al-manâzil al-fahwâniyya (RG 412), d'après des mss. très tardifs de Dâr al-kutub. S. 'Abd al-Fattâh compare ce texte à celui édité par 'Afîfî (Revue de la Faculté des Lettres de l'Université d'Alexandrie, VIII, 1964) en pensant qu'il s'agit de deux versions d'un même ouvrage alors que le texte édité par 'Afîfî est le Fihris (RG 142) et non l'Ijâza (qui a été édité par 'Abd al-Rahmân Badawî dans Al -Andalus, vol. XX, fasc.1, 1955).

K. al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
كتاب الإعلام بإشارات أهل الإلهام
RG №
281
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ilam
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
كتاب الإعلام بإشارات أهل الإلهام
موحد
Full

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Baghdad (?)
مكان
Date
606 or 613H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
782
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Small work, in the form of 260 sayings of different contemplatives and spiritual travellers. It is divided into seven chapters; the first six on Vision, Hearing, the Word, Union, Knowledge and Love, with the seventh, longer, chapter dealing with a diversity of subjects. According to OY, based upon the Carullah 986 ms., it was composed in Baghdad, but in our reading of the note (see 47b) it is more likely that it was copied or collated there.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 27 mss., of which at least two can be considered as historic: Beyazid 3750 (c.782H) which was copied from IA’s original, and Carullah 286 (undated but early) which carries a note (see 47b) saying that it was copied and collated against a copy which had been read to the author; also Khalidiyya 892 (c.656H)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
782
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Insān al-kullī
كتاب الإنسان الكلي
RG №
293
Alt. RG №
802
xml:id
insan
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Insān al-kullī
كتاب الإنسان الكلي
موحد
Full
K. al-Insān al-kulli fī maʿrifat al-ʿalām al-ʿulwī wa al-suflī
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥa wujūd ʿālam al-takwīn wa-l-tadbīr
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
1057
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on creation of spirits, Pen, Throne, the heavens and ranks of angels. Books mentioned in text are K. al-Nikāḥ (RG 544), K. al-Nafs (RG 521?) and al-Durra al-bayḍāʾ.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites four mss., all of them late. According to him, the preface is identical to ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz (RG802) but the end differs – our preliminary inspection indicates that the beginning is a variant, and it goes up to end of chapter on falak al-kawākib, with an extra piece at the end. Similar in content to Chapter 7 in FM. Needs some further research to determine whether this is really an independent work.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
1057
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Insān al-kullī
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. Inshāʾ al-dawāʾir
كتاب إنشاء الدوائر
RG №
289
Alt. RG №
xml:id
insha
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Inshāʾ al-dawāʾir
كتاب إنشاء الدوائر
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-insān ʿalā ṣuratihi wa-khaṣṣaha bi-sarīratihi
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها

Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
655
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
One of Ibn ʿArabī’s most important minor treatises, this work deals with the fundamental premises of his metaphysics; the Divine Essence and Attributes, the human being as the intermediary between Creator and Creation, and the author’s conception of the Universal Reality (al-haqīqa al-kulliya). Built around a pronounced philosophical framework, almost in the kalām style, and copiously illustrated with diagrams and tables. (Fenton and Gloton).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by two historic mss.: Manisa 1183 (655H taken from al-Ḥabashī’s copy), and Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667 and copied by disciple of SQ’s). We know from its mention in al-Tadbīrāt al-Ilāhīya (see Elmore JMIAS 29) that this was one of the first works IA began, but the surviving versions are later, probably written in Tunis in 598/1202 at the home of al-Mahdawī (see FM. Chapter 4).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
655
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Inshāʾ al-dawāʾir
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
A critical edition of the Arabic text and a commentary in German was first produced H S Nyberg’s Kleinere Schriften des Ibn al-ʿArabî, (Leiden 1919), pp. 1-38. The Arabic text was reproduced in Fenton and Gloton’s French translation La Productions des cercles (Paris, 1996). Critical edition by Maurizio Marconi in Azufre Rojo vol. 5 (2018). A new critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, is forthcoming from the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, not yet published.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Paul Fenton and Maurice Gloton: ‘The Book of the Description of the Encompassing Circles’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), London, 1993 French translation by Paul Fenton and Maurice Gloton: La Productions des cercles, Paris, 1996. Italian translation by Maurizio Marconi: ‘Il Libro della produzione dei cerchi (kitâb inshâ’i-d-dawâ’ir)’, publication forthcoming (probably 2015).

Studies

R. al-Intiṣār
رسالة الإنتصار
RG №
294
Alt. RG №
xml:id
intisar
Title
عنوان
Uniform
R. al-Intiṣār
رسالة الإنتصار
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafā wa ʿalā ʿAbd al-Laṭīf b. Aḥmad al-Baghdādī
حمدله
حمدله

درجة الصحة

703
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Explanation of several verses by Hallāj and Bisṭāmī. Written in response to Shaykh ʿAbd al-Laṭīf b. Aḥmad b. M al-Baghdādī via Shaykh Abū ʿAbd Allāh M. b. ʿAbd Allāh al-Sharīf al-Fāsī known as Ibn Ṣinhājī (?).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 11 mss., of which none can be considered definitively historic. However, the internal evidence for its authenticity is incontrovertible. The best mss. are Ayasofia 2063 (c.703H), and Shehit Ali 1341 (724H). It also appears in good collections such as Carullah 986 and 2080.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
703
Library
Code
Pag-es

K. al-Isfār ʿan natāʾij al-asfār
كتاب الإسفار عن نتائج الأسفار
RG №
307
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isfar
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Isfār ʿan natāʾij al-asfār
كتاب الإسفار عن نتائج الأسفار
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-kāʾin fi-l-ʿamā al-mawṣūf bi-l-istiwāʾ jalāl dhātihi
حمدله
حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise explaining the principles of spiritual journeying (to, from and in God), and the inner meanings of various divine and prophetic journeys, such as the descent of the Qurʿān, the ascension of Muhammad, the fall of Adam, and the journeys of Idris/Enoch, Noah, Abraham, Lot, Jacob, Joseph and Moses.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 19 mss., verified by three historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4859 which is an IA holograph, with a samāʿ, but the ms. has been stolen so only a digitised microfilm is now available (first pages missing). Koprulu 713 contains a copy of this ms., dated 663H in Konya. Critical edition by D. Gril, and new critical edition with translation by Angela Jaffray.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Isfār ʿan natāʾij al-asfār

Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
A critical edition by Denis Gril was printed alongside his French translation in Le Dévoilement des Effets du Voyage (Paris, 1994). This did not have access to the holograph (Yusuf Ağa 4859). An amended edition, based on the Gril’s work but including Yusuf Ağa 4859, plus a translation into Urdu, has been published by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 2013). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Angla Jaffray: The Secrets of Journeying, Anqa Publishing, Oxford, 2015. French translation by Denis Gril: Le Dévoilement des Effets du Voyage, Paris 1994
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

Critical edition by Souad Hakim. Edition (DG) and trans in progress (AJ)
Editions de l’éclat, 1994, into French by Denis Gril. See P/438

Ishārāt al-Qurʾān fī ʿālam al-insān
إشارات القرآن في عالم الإنسان
RG №
303
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isharat

عنوان
Uniform
Ishārāt al-Qurʾān fī ʿālam al-insān
إشارات القرآن في عالم الإنسان
موحد
Full
كامل

Malatya
مكان
Date
601
تاريخ
Earliest MS
762
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
In 601H for his friend al-Ḥabashī (see Vel.51/18b).
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentary upon the verses of the Qurʾān, conceived as a companion volume to al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya (RG 762). Written for IA’s companion, Badr al-Ḥabashī.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 10 mss., verified by two historic mss., Veliyuddin 51 (c.762H, taken from original in the hand of IA dated 601H) and Yusuf Ağa 7838. According to OY, written 602H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, no place is given. The date given is Ramadan 601H, when it is known that IA was in Malatya. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
762
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ishārāt al-Qurʾān fī ʿālam al-insān
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Related work: tan_maw (762) - nature of relation? Jane anc McAuley’s article: “The Ishârât al-Qur’ân were completed at noon on Wednesday the 13th day of glorious Ramadân in 601. I wrote it out (nasakhtuhu) for my friend al-Mas’ûd ‘Abd Allâh Badr b. ‘Abd Allâh al-Habashî, the freed slave of Abû al-Ghanâîim b. Abî al-Futûh al-Harrân’…”

K. al-Isrā ilā al-maqām al-asrā
كتاب الإسرا إلي المقام الأسرى
RG №
313
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isra

K. al-Isrā ilā al-maqām al-asrā
كتاب الإسرا إلي المقام الأسرى
موحد
Full
K. al-Isra ila-l-maqām al-asrā
كامل

al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī salakha niḥārahu min laylihi

Note on Authenticity

تاريخ
