633
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Description, in rhyming couplets, of IA’s miʿrāj (spiritual ascension) in Fez, written very soon after the event in 594H.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 30 mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1628 (read to the author in 633H), which formed the basis of Souad al-Hakim’s critical edition. Ragib Pasha 1453, whilst it is very late, is taken from SQ’s original.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
633
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Isrā ilā al-maqām al-asrā

al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfiyya
الإصطلاحات الصوفية
RG №
315
Alt. RG №
xml:id
istilahat
Title
عنوان
Uniform
al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfiyya
الإصطلاحات الصوفية
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafā wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā wa-ʿalayka ayyuhā al-ḥamīm…
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Malatya
مكان
Date
615H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
637
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise consisting of succinct definitions of 199 commonly used technical Sufi terms. There are three different versions of the text (see below). The first part is based on Qushayrī’s definitions in his Risāla.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least seven historic mss. However, there are three verifiable versions of the original text: version A in Damascus (begins with waqt), without introduction, copied by Ayyūb b. Badr (see Manisa 1183, c. 650H), version B in Konya in a different order (begins with hājis), with an introduction, which was written in Malatya in 615H (see Milli 571, 668H), and version C which was included in the FM (II 128–34; Chapter 173, the response to al-Tirmidhī’s question 153), and consists of version B in reverse order with added questions linking each term.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
637
Library
Code
Pag-es
al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfiyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. Critical Edition in progress by Stephen Hirtenstein.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Rabia Terri-Harris:’Sufi Terminology: Ibn ʿArabī’s Al-iṣṭilāh al-ṣūfiyyah’ in JMIAS 3, 1984, pp. 27-54.
Spanish translation by Mohammed Amrani & Alfonso González: Guía Espiritual, Murcia, 1990.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add -Edition, Le Caire, 1357h. -Ed. Le Caire, s.d., par 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd. -Ed. Beyrouth, 1990 par Bassâm 'Abd al-Wahhâb al-Jabbî -Traduction anglaise par R. Terri Harris, JMIAS, 1984, III, p. 27-54. (MC)
Edition in progress (SH)

R. al-Ittiḥād al-kawnī
رسالة الإتحاد الكوني
RG №
317
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ittihad
Title
عنوان
Uniform
R. al-Ittiḥād al-kawnī
رسالة الإتحاد الكوني
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
Epistle in which is shown how the creature rediscovers the mnunity to which his essential being bears witness, and how he is brought into the presence of the human tree and the four spiritual birds.
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
hādhā kitāb karīm wa-khiṭāb jasīm...

Verified A
درجة الصحة

Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
>598H
تاريخ

621
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
A letter was written by IA for Abū l-Fawāris Ṣakhr b. Sinān (Vel.51/48a)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A poetical work on the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil), the supreme intellect, the guarded tablet, the materia prima, and the universal body. One of IA’s earlier Maghribi works. See Angela Jaffray’s introduction and translation, The Universal Tree and the Four Birds (Oxford, 2005).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 21 mss., of which three are historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in the presence of IA) and Veliyuddin 51 (c. 762H, copied from al-Ḥabashī’s original).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
621

Code
Pag-es

Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition established by Denis Gril and published alongside his French translation Le Livre de l’Arbre et des Quatre Oisaux (Paris, 1984). This text is also reproduced in Angela Jaffray’s English translation The Universal Tree and the Four Birds (Oxford, 2006). Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Angela Jaffray: The Universal Tree and the Four Birds, Oxford, 2006 Translated into French by Denis Gril: Le Livre de l’Arbre et des Quatre Oisaux, Paris, 1984
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add Edition critique et trad. française par D. Gril, sous le titre Le Livre de l'Arbre et des quatre oiseaux, Annales islamologiques, IFAO, Le Caire, XVII, 1981. La traduction française seule a été rééditée sous le même titre, Edition Les Deux Océans, Paris, 1984. (MC)
Edition by DG and translation by AJ forthcoming.

K. al-Jalāl wa-l-jamāl
كتاب الجلال والجمال
RG №
168
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jalal
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Jalāl wa-l-jamāl
كتاب الجلال والجمال
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ʿaẓīm jalāluhu al-mahbūb (li-ẓuhūr) jamāluhu al-baʿīd fī dunūhi al-qarīb fī sumūhi

Author

مؤلف

Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mosul
مكان
Date
601
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<615
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Composed in one day in 601H in Mosul (see Veliyuddin 1826, 52b)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Reflections on the meaning of Majesty and Beauty, as opposing aspects, and how they relate to intimacy and awe on the human side, with a discussion of Qurʾanic verses in the light of the two divine principles, alluding to the third aspect which integrates them, the balance of perfection. Written in one day in 601H in Mosul.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 20 mss., of which the earliest is the undated holograph extract (Yusuf Aga 4868). Berlin spr 783 was copied in IA’s lifetime (pm 185 was listed by OY as an SQ autograph, which it is not). There are several dated from the 8th century.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<615
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Jalāl wa-l-jamāl
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف

Jerusalem
مكان
Date
601
تاريخ

615
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Secrets and the spiritual power contained in the letters of the name ‘Allāh’.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by seven historic mss. The best is a holograph, Yusuf Aga 4868 (ms. stolen, so copy digitised from microfilm). Yusuf Aga 7838 was probably written in IA’s lifetime, and Milli A571, dated 668H, was copied and checked against IA’s copy. Carullah 2111 was copied from a holograph dated 628H and collated with an autograph dated 637H. According to OY, composed in 601H in Jerusalem.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
615
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Jalāla
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-durra al-bayḍāʾ
جواب عن مسألة الدرة البيضاء
RG №
178
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-dur
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-durra al-bayḍāʾ
جواب عن مسألة الدرة البيضاء
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
iʿlam an Allāhu subḥānahu wa-taʿālā huwa al-mawjūd al-muṭlaq lā ʿan ʿadam
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the relationship between Being, non-existence and the possible, with a discussion of the various terms for the First Intellect.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Two mss. cited by OY, including Veliyuddin 1821 which our inspection shows to be unattributed to IA. In its current form it is unlikely to be by IA as in FM he does not use the term al-mawjūd al-muṭlaq, only al-wujūd al-muṭlaq (eg FM 1:44, 76, 365, 718 etc ), and the phrase al-durra al-bayḍāʾ occurs only twice (FM 1:46, 2:30) (SH). Further work needed.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
Library
Code
Pag-es
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-durra al-bayḍāʾ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqīm ʿammā saʾal ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-Ḥakīm
كتاب الجواب المستقيم عما سأل عنه الترمذي الحكيم
RG №
177
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-mus
Title

K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqīm ʿammā saʾal ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-Ḥakīm
كتاب الجواب المستقيم عما سأل عنه الترمذي الحكيم
موحد
Full
K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqim ʿanmā saʾala ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-ḥakīm
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers

Incipit
saʾalt ayuhā al-akh al-waliyy al-ḥamīm an ashraḥ laka al-masāʾil al-rūhāniyya
حمدله

Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
603
تاريخ
Earliest MS
617?
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A response to various questions about mystical and esoteric matters posed by al-Tirmidhī (d. 285/898) in his famous work, Khatm al-awliyāʾ (Seal of the Saints). It consists of 55 questions and answers. A similar section is included in FM 2:39-139, but according to Michel Chodkiewicz it is not identical to this work.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 11 mss., the best being Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph, undated but necessarily before 638H. OY dates the composition as 603H based on a note on Beyazit 3750 (253b), but we could not find any indication of this; it looks as if there has been confusion with another work in the same collection.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
617?
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqīm ʿammā saʾal ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-Ḥakīm
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
relation
Note on Related Works
Cross-references
إحالات مزدوجة
To this work
إلى هذا المصنف
Ijāza
Reference to work in the Ijāza
الإجازة
Fihrist
Reference to work in the Fihrist
الفهرست
Futūḥāt
References to work in Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add A titre d'informations complémentaires je signale que le fameux questionnaire de Tirmidhî a suscité d'autres réponses: -Qurrat-al-'ayn fî l-jawâb 'an al-as'ila al-muwadda'a fî khabi'at al-kawn; (inédit sauf erreur); ouvrage du shaykh Ahmad al-'Ayyâshî Sukayraj al-Ansârî, shaykh tijânî mort en 1944. -Al-jawâb al-shafî 'alâ as'ilat al-Hakîm al-Tirmidhî, (Le Caire, 1987) dont l'auteur, Muhammad 'Alî Salâma identifie le khatm muhammadî avec le shaykh égyptien Abû l-'Azâ'im, mort en 1938. Je n'ai pu lire le premier de ces deux ouvrages; le second est d'une décevante platitude. Corr Contrairement à ce qu'indiquait O. Y. cet ouvrage n'est pas "inclus dans les Futûhât ", ainsi que l'a d'ailleurs montré O.Y. lui-même par la suite dans son édition du Khatm al-awliyâ' de Tirmidhî, Beyrouth 1965. Il publie en effet en notes (pp. 142 à 326) les réponses au questionnaire de Tirmidhî qui figurent dans le Jawâb mustaqîm et celles, beaucoup plus longues et très différentes dans leur contenu, qui se trouvent dans le chapitre 73 des Futûhât. Les deux textes ont le même objet mais ne peuvent en aucune façon être considérés comme identiques. (MC)

جواب عن مسألة السبجة السوداء
موحد

Note on Title

Incipit
Jawāb ʿan masʾalāt al-sabaja al-sawdāʾ wa-hiya al-hayūlā.
حمدله

Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة

Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها

ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
>950
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the nature of the materia prima, time, and the celestial spheres in terms reminiscent of IA’s teachings. According to Claude Addas, likely to be authentic and part of three short treatises, which have been edited by Abd al-Baqi Miftah.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only two mss. mentioned by OY (see p. 269), neither of them with good provenance. Berlin 2960 is very late, and there is nothing on the work to indicate that it is by IA, except that it is part of collection of works, by IA and other Sufi authors. We have not managed to inspect the other, Ismail Saïb 1197. Also mss at Cairo Khedivial 6/90 (16368), Dar al-Kutub 1/246 (46) and Vienna, Kaiser 1910/3 and Mecca Haram 3939.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
>950
Library
Code
Pag-es
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-sabaja al-sawdāʾ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakīn
جواب سؤال ابن سودكين
RG №
182
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-sawd
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakīn
جواب سؤال ابن سودكين
موحد
Full
Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakîn ʿan a’lā al-marātib wa-l aḥwāl:
كامل
Variant
K. al-’iqd al-manzûm; Al-ajwiba ‘alâ masâ’il Ibn Sawdakîn ‘an a’lâ al-marâtib wa-l ahwâl; R. fî su’al Ibn Sawdakîn.

TPQ-TAQ

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Response to a question on the highest degree of spiritual states which can be reached by the people of God, by Ibn Sawdakīn (d.646/1248) reporting from Ibn ‘Arabi.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Seven mss. cited by OY, verified by two historic ones. The best is Yusuf Aga 4868, which was copied during IA’s lifetime.

Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakīn

Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ
جواب عن مسألة الزمردة الخضراء
RG №
180
Alt. RG №
434
xml:id
jawab-zum
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ
جواب عن مسألة الزمردة الخضراء
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
Jawāb ʿan masʾalāt al-zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ
حمدله
حمدله

Muqadimma
مقدمة

Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف

Date
تاريخ

1202
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the universal soul.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A work called K. al-nafs wa-huwa k. al-Zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ is mentioned in ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz. It is also part of RG 434. OY lists only two mss. for this work. Berlin 3001 is very late, and there is nothing on the work to indicate that it is by IA. We have not managed to inspect the other, Ismail Saïb 1197. ‘Abd al-Baqi Miftah has edited this, and Claude Addas believes it to be authentic.

K. Kashf al-maʿnā
كتاب كشف المعنى
RG №
338
Alt. RG №
xml:id
kashf
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Kashf al-maʿnā
كتاب كشف المعنى
موحد
Full
K. Kashf al-maʿnā ʿan sirr asmāʾ Allāh al-ḥusnā
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
The Secret of the Names of God
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
qāla Allāh taʿālā wa-lillāh al-asmāʾ al-ḥusnā fa-adʿūhu bihā
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
621H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
783
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentaries on the 99 Divine Names of God. After a brief introduction in which the traditional theological categories of the Names are laid out, the 99 Names of God (as in al-Ghazālī’s listing) are treated according to three concepts (first proposed by Abū Madyan): taʿalluq (dependence); taḥaqquq (realisation); and takhalluq (assimilation). Critical edition and Spanish translation by P. Beneito.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 22 mss., although none can be considered truly historic. However, the evidence is compelling: Ulu Cami 1581 (c.826H) may have been copied from an original, as it carries a note by IA about the composition of the work, that it was written in Ramaḍān 621H for a known disciple, Sharafuddīn Abū Muḥammad ʿAbd al-Wāḥid b. Abū Bakr b. Sulaymān al-Ḥamawī. The earliest copy is Fatih 5298, dated 783H, which also has a colophon saying that it is a work by IA and that it was dictated to a student in 621H in Damascus. A work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza l-il-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269), and there is a correspondence with other works on the Divine Names (see FM 559).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
783
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Kashf al-maʿnā
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition published by Pablo Beneito and published alongside his Spanish translation El secreto de los nombres de Dios (Murcia, 1996). This text is also reproduced alongside the French translation Les Secret des Noms de Dieu (Paris, 2010). A newer edition, alongside an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2014). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (with Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī) (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Stephen Hirtenstein and Pablo Beneito: The Secret of the Names of God, Anqa Publishing, forthcoming. Spanish translation by Pablo Beneito: El secreto de los nombres de Dios, Murcia, 1996. French translation by Pablo Beneito: Les Secret des Noms de Dieu, Paris, 2010. Italian translation by Pablo Beneito, I Nomi più belli di Dio, Milano, 2011
Italian translation by Pablo Beneito, Alberto De Luca: Il segreto dei 99 nomi di Dio : il capitolo 558 delle Futûhât al-Makkiyya, Rome, 2007.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

Critical edition and Spanish transaltion by PB and SH, El secreto de los nombres de Dios (Murcia, 1996). English trans in progress (CT)
Murcia, 1996, into spanish by Pablo Benito. See P/435

al-Kawkab al-durrī fī manāqib Dhī al-Nūn al-Miṣrī
الكوكب الدري في مناقب ذي النون المصري
RG №
347.1
Alt. RG №
xml:id
kawkab
Title
عنوان
Uniform
al-Kawkab al-durrī fī manāqib Dhī al-Nūn al-Miṣrī
الكوكب الدري في مناقب ذي النون المصري
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers

al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hayyama qulūb al-ʿārifīn fī awdiyat maḥabbatihi
حمدله

درجة الصحة
Authentication

Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
712
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Stories of Dhū al-Nūn (d. 180/796), the famous early Egyptian Sufi master, recorded by IA from various companions. Written after the death of Yūnus b. Yaḥyā (d. 608H), who is referred to as no longer alive, and perhaps composed in Cairo where Dhū al-Nūn is buried.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Not listed in OY, and only one ms. in the Topkapi library is extant. Its acceptance as a verified text by IA comes from the internal evidence of the people cited in the text (Stephen Hirtenstein). There are two printed Arabic editions; one by ʿAbd al-Fattāh in Rasāʾil (Vol 3) and one by Ibrahīm al-Kayyālī (Beirut 2005).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
712
Library
Code
Pag-es
al-Kawkab al-durrī fī manāqib Dhī al-Nūn al-Miṣrī
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Khalwa
كتاب الخلوة
RG №
255

Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī alhama al-ṣafwa min ʿibādihi
حمدله
حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers

Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف

Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<668
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
On retreat in general, but mentioning some particular kinds of retreat at end, e.g. the hoopoe retreat. Written for Abū al-ʿAbbās Aḥmad b. ʿAlī b. Maymūn b. Ab al-Tawzarī (see Chapter 69 of FM (1:91)).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work under various titles, verified by three historic mss. The earliest is either Koprulu 766 (pre-638?) or Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667). Sometimes confused with R. al-Anwār (RG 33). Mentioned in both FM and Maqām al-qurba.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<668
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Khalwa
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

R. al-Khirqa
رسالة الخرقة
RG №
530
Alt. RG №
xml:id
khirqa
Title
عنوان
Uniform
R. al-Khirqa
رسالة الخرقة
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaʿa ʿalā ʿibādihi ahli al-ʿināyatihi asmāʾahu al-husnā
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
633
تاريخ
Earliest MS
999
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A late work, it gives a detailed list of ‘investitures’ through which the Shaykh received initiation into the Path, including one by the hidden guide, al-Khiḍr.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 19 mss., of which one can be considered historic: Esad Ef. 1507 (999H, copied from an original dated 633H in IA’s handwriting and corrected by him). Many mss. are incomplete. Veliyuddin 51 contains only the 599H khirqa, but it is also copied from an original in the hand of IA. Further mss: Bankipore ms 955/2 (778H?)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
999
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. al-Khirqa
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
relation
Note on Related Works
Cross-references
إحالات مزدوجة
To this work
إلى هذا المصنف
Ijāza
Reference to work in the Ijāza
الإجازة
Fihrist
Reference to work in the Fihrist
الفهرست
Futūḥāt
References to work in Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition established by C. Addas in Le Livre de la filiation spirituelle (Al-Quobba Zarqua, Marrakesh, 2000).
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Gerald Elmore: ‘Ibn al-ʿArabī’s Testament on the Mantle of Inititation (al-Khirqah)’ in JMIAS, 5, 1999, pp. 1-44. French translation by Claude Addas: Le Livre de la filiation spirituelle, Al-Quobba Zarqua, Marrakesh, 2000.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add -trad. anglaise par G. Elmore sous le titre Ibn al-'Arabî's Testament on the Mantle of Initiation, JMIAS, XXVI, 1999, pp. 1-33. -Edition et traduction française par C. Addas sous le titre Le Livre de la filiation spirituelle, Marrakech, 2000. (MC)
Two translations, one by Elmore in English and one by Addas in French. Edition in progress (GE)

Alternate title: Nasab al-Khirqa Dating: 599H khirqa seems to already have been written in 601/602H (see Veliyuddin 51), though not as a complete work... written over a period?

K. Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minhu
كتاب كنه ما لا بد للمريد منه
RG №
352

kunh

Note on Authenticity

Mosul

601H
تاريخ

724
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Advice to the student starting out on the Sufi path.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work (OY lists 35 mss.), verified by three historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 1341 (724H taken from an original in the hand of IA), Manisa 1183 (650H, written by a direct student of IA’s), and Veliyuddin 51 (762H and copied from IA’s original). According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.) Further mss identified by JC: Bankipore ms 955/1 (778H), said to be transcribed from autograph; KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 109-163
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
724
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minhu
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

طبعات
Translations
English translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi: ‘What the Student Needs: Ibn ʿArabī’s Ma la budda minhu lil-murid’ in JMIAS 5, 1986, pp. 28-55. English Translation by Tosun Bayrak and Rabia Terri Harris: What the Seeker Needs, USA, 1993 English translation by Shaykh Tosun Bayrak: Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom, plus ‘What the seeker needs’ and ‘Treatise on Unity’, Louisville, 1997. English translation by James Morris in his paper From ethics and devotion to spiritual realisation : Ibn ‘Arabî on what is indispensable for the spiritual seeker, Kuala Lumpur : Centre for Civilisational Dialogue, University of Malaysia, 2007, 32 p. Italian translation by Placido Fontanesi, Il libro di ciò che è essenziale riguardo a quanto è indispensabile per l’aspirante, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1982, pp. 7-22
Spanish translation by Mohammed Amrani & Alfonso González: Guía Espiritual, Murcia, 1990 Spanish translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi al-Halveti, Afife Traverso and Emilio Alzueta: El divino gobierno del reino humano, Lo que necesita el buscador tratador sobre el uno y único, Granada, 2004.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add. Edition Le Caire, 1387/1967, et 1987 Traduction anglaise par Arthur Jeffery (Instructions for a postulant) dans A Readear on Islam , Londres, 1962, pp. 640-655. (MC)
Forthcoming translation by Jim Morris in JMIAS. Tosun Bayrak’s version is not the same as Morris’s, as it comes from a later edition in Turkish rather than the original Arabic.
Partial translation by Asin Palacios in El Islam christianizado pp371-377. Edition Madrid, 1931

Dating Denis and Jane: “Osman Yahia maintains that the work was composed in Mosul in 601, and he gives as his source not Veliyuddin 51 but a reference in Brockelmann, who lists other manuscripts, outside Turkey, which we have not yet inspected.” This could make sense given qas_ilah was composed in Mosul on this date in the same collection...

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of letters from the author to different people, some containing poems.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., none of which are definitively historic. Internal evidence for attribution (e.g. mention of Seville, al-Muḥāsibī, al-Shakkāz in Granada, Ibn Saydabūn) is compelling, however. There is a lot of variation in the number of letters, with Fatih 5322 giving 43 in total, Carullah 986 22 and Carullah 2080 only 13. Further mss identified by JC: Uppsala 162/15 (ff.77b-82a)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<700

Pag-es
R. al-Kutub

samʿatu sayyidī Muhyī al-Dīn yaqūl wa-kunā fī khalwa

Composition

أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A record of the discussions on various topics which Ibn Sawdakīn (d. 646) had with his master Ibn ʿArabī. The content includes that of K. al-Wasāʾil by Ibn Sawdakīn (RG 436), which is really an extract of this longer work.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY states that there are no extant mss of this work, but three copies have now been found: the earliest is Zahiriyya 16632, which is in the hand of al-Farghānī, probably dateable to 660s. There are also much later less reliable copies in the Budeiri library, 142, and in the Dar al-Kutub, Cairo, Taymur 147. Further mss identified by JC: Damascus al-Assad (http://www.alassad-library.gov.sy/Search_makhtotat2013.php): 16627/2 which follows IA’s ʿAqīda, dated 955.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Lawāqiḥ al-asrār
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

corrections
additions
Corr La brève notice d'O.Y. est ambigüe. Ce titre, comme le confirme Sha'rânî (Al-yawâqit wa l-jawâhir, Le Caire, 1369h., II, p. 182) est celui d'un recueil dans lequel Ibn Sawdakîn a rassemblé des propos d'Ibn Arabî.

People: Ibn Sawdakīn - compiler and author (?) <persName role="com" key="person_0000">Ibn Sawdakīn</persName> <author cert="high" key="person_0000">Ibn Sawdakīn</author> Related item: K. al-Wasāʾil by Ibn Sawdakīn (RG 436) is an extract of K. Lawāqiḥ al-asrār (368.1)

al-ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim asrāruhu wa-muṭliʿ shumūs ʿilmihi...

725
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the science of letters, a relatively simple work of letter correspondences.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss: he considers it a resumé of RG 297, ʿIqd al-manẓūm , and the mss. are classified in a very confusing way between the two RGs. A quick check of all the mss. shows that they are fundamentally the same work, with some variations. We therefore suggest reclassifying all of them under RG 384. There are no definitive historic mss., although Shehit Ali 1341 is early. OY has Veliyudin 51 as copied from an original, but in our opinion the note refers to the previous work (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley in JMIAS 36). Nevertheless, the work appears in many early collections and there is a good case for its authenticity.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
725
Library
Code
Pag-es
Madkhal fī ʿilm al-ḥurūf
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Jose Bellver is working on a critical edition and study/translation.
msAdditions
JC
MC
AAS
Root
CA
SH
JC
AK
MM
AP
Related Item: RG 297 (OY duplicate) Denis and Jane (Vel.51): . Osman Yahia calls it K. ‘Iqd al-manzûm and assigns to it RG 297 along with eight other manuscripts. However, he also assigns RG 384, Madkhal fî’ilm al-hurûf to four of these. This has led to a very confusing situation which requires another article to satisfactorily resolve.[27] The question of the status of the work in Veliyuddin 51, however, can be addressed. Although it has no specific notes attached to it, it may well be covered by the general note on 84a, in which case it would have been copied from an original autograph. On the other hand, it is at the end of the collection and the following work, Istilâhât al-sûfiyya, although it has a note with a copying date (see below), again makes no mention of having been taken from an autograph. In view of the consistent notes throughout the rest of the collection, it may be that these last two works were added slightly later from other sources, and so were not covered by the note on 84a. None of the other manuscripts have a provenance which would definitively establish ‘Iqd al-manzûm as an Ibn ‘Arabî work, and Veliyuddin 51 has therefore been cited as the best source. But on the basis of what we have said above, the evidence is not sufficient to prove authenticity beyond doubt.
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive

أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the ‘keys’ that allow one to enter the unseen world. See also FM 1:173.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 28 mss., and at least two can be considered definitely historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and checked by IA) and Private 1 (c. 637H, written by a close disciple).

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mecca
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
600
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A work on Islamic law (fiqh). In Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142), IA says that he composed this work in Mecca in three parts: the first on ritual purity, the second and third on the prayer itself. There is just one extant copy, which is the second part of the work.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by one historic ms., Yusuf Ağa 4986, an autograph dated 600H which was part of SQ’s library. Original ms. was stolen, so we only have a digital copy of a photocopy. According to information in Konya, the book was gifted to SQ’s mother as a wedding gift by IA.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
600
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Maḥajja al-bayḍāʾ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إلى مصنفات أخرى

Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan), ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, , but not yet published. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.

R. al-Maʿlūm min ʿaqāʾid ʿulamāʾ al-rusūm
رسالة المعلوم من عقائد علماء الرسوم
RG №
402
Alt. RG №
xml:id
malum
Title
عنوان
Uniform
R. al-Maʿlūm min ʿaqāʾid ʿulamāʾ al-rusūm
رسالة المعلوم من عقائد علماء الرسوم
موحد
Full
كامل

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة

Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف

درجة الصحة

Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف

Damascus
مكان

602
تاريخ

762
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Damascus on 3 Jumādā 602H (Vel.51/114a)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on four kinds of knowers (ʿulamāʾ) at the Well of Arīn (axis mundi): those of the west (maghrib), those of the east (mashriq), those of the north (shimāl) and those of the south (yamīn), and their kinds of knowledge. See also FM 1:38-41.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites seven mss. Verified by one historic ms.,Veliyuddin 51 (762H, copied from an original composed in Damascus in 602H). Milli 2988 is the same text, but the other two mss. we have consulted are different texts. Confused with RG 34 and others. Further work needed. Further mss identified by JC: Tunis, Dar al-Kutub al-Wataniya 641, and Escurial ms 417 / 4 (f. 117-131?)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
762
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. al-Maʿlūm min ʿaqāʾid ʿulamāʾ al-rusūm
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Jane and Denis (vel.51): At the end, on 114a, there is a note saying that it was composed in Damascus on 3rd Jumâdâ al-ûlâ of the year 602

K. Manzil al-manāzil
كتاب منزل المنازل
RG №
412
Alt. RG №
xml:id
manzil
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Manzil al-manāzil
كتاب منزل المنازل
موحد
Full
K. Manzil al-manāzil al-fahwāniyya
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nafakha al-ʿuqūl bi-ʿulūm al-riyāḍāt
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
603H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
618
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
An intricate treatise describing an elaborate hierarchy of ‘way-stations’ or ‘abodes’ (see Michel Chodkiewicz, Ocean, 64–67). There are 19 major manāzil, corresponding to 19 classes of Qur’anic suras, many of which are sub-divided. The work is also known as Kitāb al-fahwāniyya, a technical term designating the Divine Speech addressing the servant face to face in the presence of imagination. Here, it denotes the comprehensive way-station of basmala, which has 19 letters. The treatise ends with an account of the mystical ascent (mirʿāj). See FM I:171-180.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 10 mss., with one very good historic ms. verifying the work: the holograph Veliyuddin 1759 (618H) with a samāʿ written by Ibn Sawakīn in Aleppo. It also appears in other good collections, particularly Beyazid 3750 and Carullah 986. OY dates the composition to 603H based on a note at the end of Beyazit 3750 (432a), but we could not verify this; it is possible that there is some confusion with a note on another work.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
618
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Manzil al-manāzil
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add Edition par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995 (précédé de RG. 269 et suivi de RG. 46). Cette édition est exclusivement basée sur le ms. autographe Veliyuddin 1759 dont l'écriture maghrébine est peu familière à l'éditeur.On y repère certaines erreurs de lecture que signale en général une incorrection grammaticale. Elle est néanmoins très utile mais sa courte introduction est décevante. La notion de fahwâniyya-la "Parole face-à-face" dans le 'âlam al-khayâl-qui apparaît souvent dans les écrits d'Ibn Arabî (Futûhât, Tajalliyât, K. al-'abâdila...) est correctement expliquée par la définition qui se trouve dans Fut., II, p. 128 (question 152, définition n°8) et dans les Istilâhât al-sûfiyya (déf. 192). mais il aurait été souhaitable de signaler qu'elle a chez Ibn Arabî, dans l'emploi du 'ilm al-hurûf, une conséquence importante : à la différence du mode de calcul normal elle oblige à prendre en considération les valeurs numériques des lettres effectivement prononcées (et non pas seulemnt de celles qui sont écrites). C'est pourquoi, par exemple, le nom al-rahmân (=330) a une valeur de 530 dans la hadra fahwaniyya (Fut. I, 185), la lettre râ (=200) y étant comptée deux fois. De même le nom Muhammad (MHMD) dont la somme des lettres est de 92 a, dans la hadra fahwâniyya, la valeur 132 qui correspond à MHMMD. L'éditeur ne semble pas d'autre part avoir vu que, dans cet ouvrage, comme dans le chapitre 22 et dans le fasl al-manâzil des Futûhât, le terme manzil renvoie toujours au Coran et désigne, soit une sourate ou un groupe de sourates, soit un verset, un mot ou une lettre du Livre. C'est cette hiérarchie de significations que l'on doit avoir en vue pour comprendre ce texte apparemment cryptique. Ibn Arabî en donne d'ailleurs lui-même la clef lorsqu'il énumère (p. 113) les 19 catégories de sourates. Il est donc facile de saisir que, par exemple, le manzil al-thanâ' regroupe les cinq sourates qui commencent par al-hamdu li-Llâh, le manzil al-rumûz celles qui commencent par les hurûf nûrâniyya, le manzil al-nidâ celles qui commencent par yâ ayyuhâ etc. Quand Ibn Arabî indique qu'entre tel manzil et tel autre il y a x manâzil, ce nombre est celui des sourates intermédiaires. (Sur le problème des manâzil voir M. Chodkiewicz, Un Océan sans rivage, pp. 87-98; trad anglaise, An Ocean without shore, pp. 64-74. (MC)


إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Add Edition par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995 (précédé de RG. 269 et suivi de RG. 46). Cette édition est exclusivement basée sur le ms. autographe Veliyuddin 1759 dont l'écriture maghrébine est peu familière à l'éditeur.On y repère certaines erreurs de lecture que signale en général une incorrection grammaticale. Elle est néanmoins très utile mais sa courte introduction est décevante. La notion de fahwâniyya-la "Parole face-à-face" dans le 'âlam al-khayâl-qui apparaît souvent dans les écrits d'Ibn Arabî (Futûhât, Tajalliyât, K. al-'abâdila...) est correctement expliquée par la définition qui se trouve dans Fut., II, p. 128 (question 152, définition n°8) et dans les Istilâhât al-sûfiyya (déf. 192). mais il aurait été souhaitable de signaler qu'elle a chez Ibn Arabî, dans l'emploi du 'ilm al-hurûf, une conséquence importante : à la différence du mode de calcul normal elle oblige à prendre en considération les valeurs numériques des lettres effectivement prononcées (et non pas seulemnt de celles qui sont écrites). C'est pourquoi, par exemple, le nom al-rahmân (=330) a une valeur de 530 dans la hadra fahwaniyya (Fut. I, 185), la lettre râ (=200) y étant comptée deux fois. De même le nom Muhammad (MHMD) dont la somme des lettres est de 92 a, dans la hadra fahwâniyya, la valeur 132 qui correspond à MHMMD. L'éditeur ne semble pas d'autre part avoir vu que, dans cet ouvrage, comme dans le chapitre 22 et dans le fasl al-manâzil des Futûhât, le terme manzil renvoie toujours au Coran et désigne, soit une sourate ou un groupe de sourates, soit un verset, un mot ou une lettre du Livre. C'est cette hiérarchie de significations que l'on doit avoir en vue pour comprendre ce texte apparemment cryptique. Ibn Arabî en donne d'ailleurs lui-même la clef lorsqu'il énumère (p. 113) les 19 catégories de sourates. Il est donc facile de saisir que, par exemple, le manzil al-thanâ' regroupe les cinq sourates qui commencent par al-hamdu li-Llâh, le manzil al-rumûz celles qui commencent par les hurûf nûrâniyya, le manzil al-nidâ celles qui commencent par yâ ayyuhâ etc. Quand Ibn Arabî indique qu'entre tel manzil et tel autre il y a x manâzil, ce nombre est celui des sourates intermédiaires. (Sur le problème des manâzil voir M. Chodkiewicz, Un Océan sans rivage, pp. 87-98; trad anglaise, An Ocean without shore, pp. 64-74.

Velioyyudin 1759, 80-102b, Autograph, sema.

مضمون
Description
OY: Treatise on the Divine Proximity and the ways of entering it.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by two good historic ms. The best is Veliyuddin 1759 (holograph with samāʿ dated 617H in Aleppo and 633H in Damascus). Also KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 152-155

Maqṣid al-asmāʾ

Full

كامل
Variant
بديل
English
The highest calling through the allusion of names and pronouns manifested by the Qur⁄ån in the language of the essential Reality and the law.

Contents
مضمون
Description
Short work on the inner meaning of Names and Attributes mentioned in the Fātiḥa.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which seven can be considered historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in the presence of IA and verified).

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. A critical edition has been prepared by Denis Gril, but it is not yet unpublished. Claude Addas writes: Cet ouvrage a été édité par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh in Rasâ'il Ibn Arabî, vol .1,Beyrouth, 2001,pp. 247-261 sur la base du ms. veliyuddin 1826. Egalement édité par \'Asim IBrâhîm al-Kiyâlî, Beyrouth, 2004, dans un volume intitulé al-shajarât al-nu\'mâniyya et contenant plusieurs traités d\'I.A authentiques ou apocryphesz selon les cas.
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

There is a study by Denis Gril, and a critical edition in progress.

K. Marātib ʿulūm al-wahb
كتاب مراتب علوم الوهب
RG №
423
Alt. RG №
xml:id
maratib
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Marātib ʿulūm al-wahb
كتاب مراتب علوم الوهب
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh munaffikh al-fuhūm wa-fātiḥ maghāliq al-ʿulūm ʿan sirr al-maktūm
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
823
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the kinds of knowledge which are given by divine grace. See FM I:57-172; 3:501-505; 4:37-38. A catalogue entry for Escurial 1607/17 (f.82) notes that the work was composed in 602H. It seems the source for this info was Brockelmann Ar. Litt. I 444.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 26 mss., verified by two good historic mss., Veliyuddin 1826 (c.823H, copied from an original in the hand of IA) and Carullah 986 (nd., checked against copy read to author). There are four other good mss., although none of them are definitive. There is a note at the end of Beyazit 3750 (151b) saying that the work is a selection from a manzil from FM (muqaddar min hādhā l-manzil min al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya). OY states that it was composed in Baghdad on the basis of a note on Carullah 986; however, this actually says that it was checked against a copy read in Baghdad.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
823
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Marātib ʿulūm al-wahb
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

203

corrections
additions
msAdditions
Carullah 986, 44b-45b, written by a disciple.
JC
MC
AAS

R. fī Maʿrifat laylat al-qadr
رسالة في معرفة ليلة القدر

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A short work on the timing of the Night of Power, and the exact moment of its appearance.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
No definitive historic mss. but two of the three surviving texts are early. The case rests on Yusuf Ağa 4883, whose provenance is still to be determined, and correlation with relevant sections of FM. The text is published with an English translation by Beneito and Hirtenstein in JMIAS 27, pp. 1-20.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
673?
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. fī Maʿrifat laylat al-qadr
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

منشورات
Editions
A critical edition of the text based upon two mss. published is by Beneito and Hirtenstein in JMIAS 27, pp. 1-20, plus an English translation.
طبعات
Translations

K. al-Maʿrifa
كتاب المعرفة الأولى
RG №
433
Alt. RG №
xml:id
marifa-ula
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Maʿrifa
كتاب المعرفة الأولى
موحد
Full
K. al-maʿrifa
كامل

بديل

al-ḥamdu lillāh wāhib al-asrār li-l-arbāb

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<658
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A gathering of metaphysical and theological questions presented in an analytical and doctrinal form. (OY)
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 18 mss, but has unfortunately conflated three separate works that contain masāʾil: K. al-maʿrifa (Carullah 986, Shehit Ali 1341, Carullah 2080, 22b, Fatih 5322, Veliyuddin 1821, Azhar 33595); ʿAqīdat ahl al-ikhtiṣāṣ (3rd profession of faith extract from Fut.I.41–47; Shehit Ali 1342, 145-146b, copied by al-Hamawayh d. 658H; ); a later collection of masāʾil from different authors including IA called K. al-Masāʾil (Esad Ef. 1477, 71-147, Carullah 2120). Maurizio Marconi has analysed all the extant mss and is preparing a critical edition of 54 masāʾil of K. al-Maʿrifa.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<658
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Maʿrifa
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

additions
RG. 424 R. fî ma'rifat Allâh et RG. 433 K. al-masâ'il Add Ces deux titres du RG. correspondent très vraisemblablement à un seul et même ouvrage également répertorié sous le titre Al-tanazzulât al-layliyya (RG. 761).

K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya
كتاب مشاهد الأسرار القدسية
RG №
432
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mashahid
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya
كتاب مشاهد الأسرار القدسية
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
Contemplations of the Holy Mysteries
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
katabtu hādhihi al-risāla ilā aṣhāb al-shaykh al-fāḍil al-ʿārif ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz b. Abū Bakr al-Qurashī al-Mahdawī... al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿālamīn ḥamdan aniyyatan lā ḥamdan huwiyyatan
حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Seville?
مكان
Date
590H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
651
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
An early work, written in the Maghreb, but we do not know whether the version we have is the same as the first recension. It consists of 14 contemplations in the style of Niffarī’s Mawāqif. There are two commentaries, one by Ibn Sawdakīn and one by Sitt al-ʿAjam, which have been used in a critical Spanish edition and an English translation of Mashāhid. There are two associated works; a prologue which is classifed by OY as RG 626, and a commentary by Ibn Sawdakīn classified as RG 684.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is probably Manisa 1183 (651H, copied by a direct disciple of IA’s) and Veliyuddin 1782 (929H, copied from an original dated 596H). Some texts include the prologue (RG 626) and an epilogue. We have classified all these under RG 432 as it is too complex to make distinctions. Michel Chodkiewicz has examined both the Manisa ms, and the Paris National ms (B. N. 6104). He finds a slight difference between them in Ibn ʿArabi’s commentary.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
651
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya

Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition established by Pablo Beneito and Souad Hakim and printed alongside their Spanish translation Las Contemplaciones de los Misterios (Murcia, 1994) Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Cecilia Twinch: Contemplation of the Holy Mysteries and the Rising of the Divine Lights, Oxford, 2001. French translation by Stéphane Ruspoli: Le Livre des Contemplation divines, Paris, 1999. French translation: Le Livre des contemplations divines : Kitâb Mashâhid l'asrar al-qudsiyya wa matâli' al-anwâr al-ilâhiyya. Edition bilingue, Paris, 1999. Spanish translation by Pablo Beneito and Suad Hakim: Las Contemplaciones de los Misterios, Murcia, 1994. Italian translation by Pablo Beneito and Suad Hakim, Le contemplazioni di Dio, Milano, 2012
تراجم

Additions

Critical edition of this work by Souad Hakim and Bakr Aladdin (Damascus 2004), see P/

Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm
مواقع النجوم
RG №
443
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mawaqi

عنوان
Uniform
Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm
مواقع النجوم
موحد
Full
Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm wa maṭālī‘ ahillat al-asrār wa-l-ʿulūm
كامل
Variant
K. sirr al-asrâr was muntahâ ‘ilm al-abrâr was huwa al-mu-sammâ bi sifr Âdam
بديل

درجة الصحة

Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Alméria
مكان
Date
595
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
According to Fut I. 347, this work was written in 595H, in 11 days during the month of Ramadan. It is dedicated to al-Habashi.
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Written for IA’s close companion, Badr al-Ḥabashī, this is said to be the book that explains what all spiritual masters need to teach. It describes three degrees of surrender (islām), faith (īmān) and true goodness (iḥsān), according to three levels of realisation. It includes a detailed discussion of how all the members and faculties of the human being participate in the Divine Praise.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least four historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 5001, written by SQ in the lifetime of IA, with a samāʿ signed by IA, although it is badly water-damaged, and Majles 594 (652H) which is taken from a copy made in Damascus in 606H. Other mss identified by JC: Bayazid 3466 (735H?)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

al-Mawʿiẓa al-ḥasana
الموعظة الحسنة
RG №
448
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mawiza

al-Mawʿiẓa al-ḥasana

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mosul
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
962
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A collection of ḥadīth, especially of sayings of prophetic figures other than Muhammad. Reported in FM 1:3.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists three mss., none of which are historic. There are some aspects which point towards its being by Ibn ‘Arabī. One ms. (Carullah 2070) quotes IA at the end: “I completed it in one day in Mosul,” and a work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). But Claude Addas has examined the text as it appears in the printed Cairo edition, and feels that the internal evidence of the text does not permit its attribution to Ibn ‘Arabī. Therefore, in the absence of further evidence, it is classified as unverified. Further mss identified by JC: Manchester, Rylands 106 X (1031H?); Riḍā (=Raza?) library, Rampur (India) 369/1 or SerialNo 3939; AccNo 8314; BookNo 997; ff.29b-41a (990H)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
962
Library
Code
Pag-es
al-Mawʿiẓa al-ḥasana
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

درجة الصحة

Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف

Aleppo
مكان
Date
617H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
617
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
On the symbolism of the letters mīm, wāw and nūn, and all the letters which make up these names.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which six can be considered historic. The best are Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph with a samāʿ dated 617H in Aleppo, and Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, copied by Ayyūd b. Badr).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
617
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Mīm
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
relation
Note on Related Works
Cross-references
إحالات مزدوجة
To this work
إلى هذا المصنف
Ijāza
74
Reference to work in the Ijāza
الإجازة
Fihrist
69
Reference to work in the Fihrist
الفهرست
Futūḥāt
References to work in Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Not an official critical edition, but the Arabic text produced by Gilis alongside his French translation Le Livre du Mîm, du Wâw et du Nūn (Paris, 2002) is taken from an excellent ms. – Shehit Ali 2813, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and read in front of IA. Another edition has been completed by Pablo Beneito but not yet published.
طبعات
Translations
French translation by Charles-André Gilis: Le Livre du Mīm, du Wāw et du Nūn, Beirut, 2002.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

Edition in progress (PB)

K. Mishkāt al-anwār fīmā ruwiya ʿan Allāh
كتاب مشكاة الأنوار فيما روي عن الله
RG №
480
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mishka
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Mishkāt al-anwār fīmā ruwiya ʿan Allāh
كتاب مشكاة الأنوار فيما روي عن الله
موحد
Full
K. Mishkāt al-anwār fī mā ruyiya ʿan Allāh min akhbār
كامل
Variant
بديل
English

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī

درجة الصحة

Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mecca
مكان
Date
599H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
678
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A collection of 101 ḥadīth made by IA. It consists of three parts; the first with 40 ḥadīth, the second with 40, and the third with 21. See Divine Sayings (Oxford, 2004) for edited text and translation.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 19 mss., of which at least nine can be considered historic, although there are no autographs. The best is Beyazit 817 (in the hand of al-Farghānī, pre-662H), Manisa 2989 (678H, copied from original) and Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667H, copied by a disciple of SQ’s.) The three parts are sometimes separated in the collections.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
678
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Mishkāt al-anwār fīmā ruwiya ʿan Allāh

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition established by Hirtenstein and Notcutt and printed alongside their English translation Divine Sayings (Oxford, 2004). This Arabic text is also reproduced in the Urdu translation by Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2013). Ed. Abrar Aḥmad Shāhī.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Lex Hixon and Fariha al-Jerrahi: 101 Diamonds, New York, 2002. English translation by Stephen Hirtenstein and Martin Notcutt: Divine Sayings, Oxford, 2004. French translation by Muhammad Valsan: La Niche des Lumieres, Paris, 1993.
Spanish translation by Ferran Grau Ribes: El tabernáculo de las luces : mishkat al anwar. 101 dichos del Profeta, Madrid, 1998.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

English translation, Divine Sayings, published by Anqa Publishing.

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of poems of ten verses each about the letters of the Arabic alphabet. The poems are also in the Dīwān (Bulaq, 855, pp. 218-232).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 14 mss., of which three can be considered historic: Halet 245 (858H, taken from an original written by IA dated 630H with a samāʿ) and University A3320 (808H, taken from the same original with several samāʿ); Topkapi Ahmet 1555 (786H). Other mss: Budeiri 36; Paris 3171/2; Br. Mus. 1527/2; Esc. 417

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Descriptions of some of IA’s dreams and visions. One of two places where IA describes his conversion under the guidance of Jesus, Moses and Muhammad (see Claude Addas, Quest for the Red Sulphur, Cambridge, 1993, p.41).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists six mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 7838, written by SQ (pre-673H).

Muḥāḍarat al-abrār
محاضرة الأبرار
RG №
493
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muhadarat
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Muḥāḍarat al-abrār
محاضرة الأبرار
موحد
Full
Muḥāḍarat al-abrār wa musāmarāt al-akhyār
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
The lectures of the godly and the conversations of the good
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية

al-hamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʿa shams al-fawāʾid fī muḥāḍarat al-abrār
حمدله
حمدله

Muqadimma
مقدمة

Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
933
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Using the same format as Sulamī’s book Maqāmāt al-awliyāʾ, a book of adab, with many stories from al-Andalus and people that IA knew.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, of which there are no historic mss, although Ahmad III A2415 is dated 712H. Brocklemann, according to OY, thinks it is apocryphal and should be attributed to Dhahabī (d.748) (see OY p. 397). But there is textual evidence that it is by IA: Claude Addas, in her biography of IA Quest for the Red Sulphur (Cambridge, 1993), refers to several passages where incidents are described which correspond to information in other verified texts; eg. pp. 211, 223, 227. Also, a work of this title is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). Michel Chodkiewicz relates that some years ago he saw an autograph copy, written in Malatya, which is in private ownership in Tunisia, but we have not yet been able to obtain a copy of this. Other mss identified: Ragib Pasha 1204 (944H); Veliyuddin 2573 ff. 1-275 (945H); Düğümlü Baba 392 (950H)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
933
Library
Code
Pag-es
Muḥāḍarat al-abrār
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira
كتاب مختصر الدرة الفاخرة
RG №
496
Alt. RG №
105
xml:id
mukhtasar-dur
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira
كتاب مختصر الدرة الفاخرة
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqaba li-l-muttaqīn...
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها
خطبة
Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Autobiographical sketches of IA’s masters in al-Andalus, a companion volume to his Rūḥ al-quds (RG 639). This work was written in Andalusia, and therefore there are no extant manuscripts of the original work. However, Ibn ʿArabī rewrote a version of the text later for a friend in Damascus, and this is the text, entitled K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira, that we now have. Abrar Ahmad adds: Shaykh Ibn Arabi says in the first paragraph of this Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-Fākhira: سألني بعض من يكرم علي من إخواني بمحروسة دمشق أن أوقفه على كتاب أودعته ذكر بعض من لقيته فانتفعت به في طريق الأخرة فلم يكن عندي حاضرا عند سواله فإني تركته بالمغرب فقيدت له هذا المختصر في ذكر بعض المشيخة؟ من أهل الله المتمكنين في طريق أهل التحقيق من الصالحين العارفين رضي الله عنهم جميعهم مستعينًا بالله تعالى ولم أذكر فيه إلا من لقيته ورأيته وصحبته من رجال ونساء وكبير في السن وصغير على قدر ما تذكرت منهم في هذا الوقت. وذكرت على كل واحد منهم حكاية رأيتها منه من كلام حكمة أو خرق عادة أو موعظة و تركت منهم كثيرا أضعاف ما ذكرت. (مختصر الدرة الفاخرة - الصفحة الأولي للمخطوط)
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There are only two extant mss.: one, Esad Ef. 1777, is listed by OY as Al-durrat al-fākhira (RG 105) and is late (1006H); the other OY lists as RG 496, K. Mukhtaṣar al-durrat al-fākhira in Veliyuddin 1800. OY lists Esad Efendi under both classifications, and Veliyuddin 1800/186-201B, under RG 496 only. We would suggest that they should both be under RG 496. The Veliyuddin ms. is early (715H) and presumably the source for Esad Ef. The main factor in considering this a verified work is the correlation with the well-verified work Rūḥ al-quds (RG 639) and the fact that it relates many of the same incidents.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Muqniʿ fī īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtaniʿ
كتاب المقنع في إيضاح السهل الممتنع
RG №
511
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muqni

K. al-Muqniʿ fī īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtaniʿ
كتاب المقنع في إيضاح السهل الممتنع
موحد
Full
K. al-Muqniʿ fi īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtanī
كامل

Note on Title

mimman nasāmā (nasāmī) fa-sammā, wa-kharaja ʿan kulli arḍin wa-samā
حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
602H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Damascus in Jumādā l-ūlā 602H (Vel.51/115a)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
An alchemical treatise on the esoteric knowledge symbolised by living water.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 16 mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 7838 (undated, but most probably written in IA’s lifetime). According to OY, the work was written in 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of notes on Veliyuddin 51 and Bayazid 3750. But our investigation of Vel. 51 shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, the note says it was written in Damascus in 602H. Bayazid 3750 likewise does not mention Jerusalem, but confirms the date of Jumādā l-ūlā 602H. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Muqniʿ fī īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtaniʿ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

AP
Jane and Denis (Vel.51): It was written (kutiba) in the city of Damascus in the month of Jumâdâ l-ûlâ of the year 602.

777
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A collection of 21 poems written in the muwashshaḥ style – a specifically Andalusian form of poetry which was common to the Muslims, Jews and Christians of the region.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There is only one copy of this text, Shehit Ali 1389 (c.777H), which has a note saying it was taken from a copy in the hand of IA. There was also a copy now lost in Yusuf Ağa 5503. A comparison with the muwashshaḥāt in the Bulaq Dīwān reveals that the 21 poems in the ms. are all in the Great Dīwān, although the order in which they are presented is different and there are minor textual variations. It is therefore unclear whether this is an extract from some version of the Dīwān, or an earlier version of a work which was later incorporated into it, so for the time being it is regarded as a stand-alone work.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
777
Library
Code
Pag-es
Al-Muwashshaḥāt al-ilāhiyya wa-l-azjāl
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Earliest MS
650
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentary on the Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam (RG 150) by IA himself.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists nine mss., verified by one definitive historic ms. and one other: Manisa 1183 (c.650H, from an original in the hand of IA) and the undated Husein Celebi 477. There is some confusion in OY between this and RG 454, Miftaḥ al-Fuṣūṣ. Some have thought that the commentary is actually by Ibn Sawdakīn (see OY p. 407), but the Husein Celebi ms states that it is by the author of the Fuṣūṣ, i.e. IA.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
650
Library
Code
Pag-es
Naqsh al-Fuṣūṣ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan), ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, in Rasāʾil Ibn al-Arabi (Volume 1). A critical edition alongside Fuṣūṣ al-Hikam with complete references to Qurʾān and ḥadith by Dr Saiyad Nizamuddin al-Husayni (Cairo, date unknown).
طبعات
Translations
English translation by William Chittick: ‘Ibn ʿArabī’s own summary of the Fuṣūṣ ‘The Imprint of the Bezels of Wisdom’, JMIAS 1, 1982.

Earliest MS
650
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of maxims showing “what cannot be relied upon” in the quest for God. It is popularly known by its variant title R. fī mā lā yuʿawwal ʿalayhi (Treatise on what cannot be relied upon).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 14 mss., of which only one can be considered historic: Manisa 1183 (650H, written by a direct disciple of IA). OY claims that Beyazit 3750 was copied from an original but our inspection has failed to confirm this. University A3239 (OY) is actually Iṣṭilāhāt (RG 315).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
650
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Naṣāʾiḥ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, by Ibn ʿArabi Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, but not yet published. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by James W Morris: ‘Introducing Ibn ʿArabī’s ‘Book of Spiritual Advice’ in JMIAS 28, 2000, pp. 1-17.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

Partial translation done by Jim Morris, JMIAS 28 (2000): 1-17.

تاريخ
Earliest MS
667
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of dhikrs (rememorations of God) and their effects for those who are brought close to the divine presence (the muqarribūn) .
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., none of which can be considered definitive or historic. The British Library OR 9632, however, which OY did not see, was written during Ibn ʿArabī’s lifetime by one of his known students, and is definitive in attributing it to him. OY says that the author quotes an event in 631H which would support the possibility of attribution. In addition, a work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
667
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Natāʾij al-adhkār
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Earliest MS
672
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of anecdotes about IA and his advice to the Seljuk sultan, written down by SQ. Some of these anecdotes are included in FM. Not catalogued by OY so we have given it a separate RG number.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one unique manuscript written by SQ himself, which is sufficient support for regarding it as a genuine work. In addition, some of the the text is also found in FM.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
672
Library
Code
Pag-es
Juzʾ yashtamilu ʿalā al-nawādir al-mulṭaqatah min lafẓ al-Shaykh

درجة الصحة
Authentication

Note on Authenticity
Composition

Place

Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
761
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The nuqabāʾ (sing. naqīb) are a category of 300 saints in the spiritual hierarchy. Defined by IA in his list of Sufi terminology (Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣuƒiyya, RG 315) as those who uncover the hidden aspects of the self (nafs).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists nine mss. of which four can be considered historic. The best are Veliyuddin 51 (c.762H, copied from an original in the hand of IA) and Manisa 1183 (655H, written by a direct disciple of IA’s). Manisa ms gives the names of 12 nuqabāʾ from the time of the Prophet, but these vary in other mss.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
761
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Nuqabāʾ
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

corrections
additions
msAdditions
Veliyyudin 51, 75-83b, eao, 762H
JC
MC
AAS
Root
CA
SH
JC
AK
MM
AP
Date: is this OY’s mistaken reading again. See Denis and Jane: The title is given on 75a, and the text begins on 75b. There is a short note at the end saying that it was copied by Ahmad b. M. b. Muthabbit and taken from an original in the hand of Ibn ‘Arabî. Osman Yahia, however, has once again stated that the work was composed in Jerusalem in 602 on the basis of this note,[18] for which we can see no justification.
MIAS Records

Nuskhat al-ḥaqq
نسخة الحق

al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʿala al-insān al-kāmil muʿallim al-malak

Date
621
تاريخ
Earliest MS
621
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Short treatise on the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil) as the microcosm of the universe.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 33 mss., of which at least three can be considered historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H in Damascus, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and checked by IA) and Berlin 2921 (637H). Other good copies, Murad Bukhari 207 and Veliyuddin 1826, were taken from Ayyūb b. Badr’s copy.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
621
Library
Code
Pag-es
Nuskhat al-ḥaqq
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Qasam al-ilāhī bi al-ism al-rabbānī
كتاب القسم الإلهي بالإسم الرباني
RG №
565

xml:id
qasam

عنوان

K. al-Qasam al-ilāhī bi al-ism al-rabbānī
كتاب القسم الإلهي بالإسم الرباني
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn

Mosul
مكان
Date
601
تاريخ
Earliest MS
761
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
29 Jumādā l-ūlā 601H in Mosul (Vel/51/68b)
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on all the Qur’anic passages relating to the name Rabb (Lord), interpreting them in a mystical manner.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 17 mss., of which two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 51 (c.782H, copied from an original in the hand of IA.) According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing. In fact, the note says that IA wrote the original ms. in Mosul in 601H. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyuddin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
761
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Qasam al-ilāhī bi al-ism al-rabbānī
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

vel.50: … I copied it from the handwriting of its author Ibn ‘Arabî. And he said (may God have mercy on him) at the end of it: “The book was completed in the city of Mosul on the 29th of Jumâdâ al-ûlâ of the year 601. And I found in his handwriting, at the end of it …”

Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the station of the spiritual ‘pole’ (quṭb) and the two Imams.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 18 mss., of which at least two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1826 (c.825H, copied from an original which had been read to IA). Carullah 2080 has a note referring to Chapter 270 of FM, which is on the same subject.

R. al-Shaykh al-ʿArabī ilā Abī ʿAlī al-Ghazzāl
رسالة الشيخ العربي إلي أبي علي الغزال
RG №
611
Alt. RG №

xml:id
risala-ghaz

R. al-Shaykh al-ʿArabī ilā Abī ʿAlī al-Ghazzāl
رسالة الشيخ العربي إلي أبي علي الغزال

li-rabbina al-ʿaẓama wa-l-jalāl wa-l-taqdīs wa-l-ijlāl
حمدله

ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
667
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A short letter to al-Ghazzāl, a disciple of the Andalusian mystic Ibn al-ʿArīf (d. 536/1141 in Marrakesh). The work is also known as R. al-Nashʾatayn (RG 533, as given in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269)). This correspondence was exchanged before the final departure of IA for the East in 598H (see the preface to the text and Rūḥ al-Quds (RG 639) (OY))
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., of which only one can be considered historic: Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667H, copied by a disciple of SQ’s in Konya). The basis for its status as verified text is the fact that the three poems it contains are all in the Paris Dīwān (BN 2348). This work has a variant title of R. al-Nashʾatayn for which OY has created a separate RG (533), which is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li al-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). However, we have consolidated the mss. under RG 611, as it is the title which appears most frequently on the mss. themselves.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
667
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. al-Shaykh al-ʿArabī ilā Abī ʿAlī al-Ghazzāl
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

R. al-Shaykh ilā al-imām al-Rāzī
رسالة الشيخ إلي الإمام الرازي

612

موحد
Full

Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā wa-ʿalā waliyyi fī Allāh taʿalā Fakhr al-Dīn al-Razī
حمدله

صحة النسبة

Note on Authenticity
Composition

Place
مكان
Date
606H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
690
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A letter written to IA’s philosopher contemporary, Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī, calling him to return from the pursuit of intellectual knowledge to spiritual intuition.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, of which there are three early mss. though none are definitive. The best is probably Shehit Ali 1341 (c.725H, a good collection with several works taken from originals in the hand of IA). However, the note at the end of this work says “taken from an original” without specifying its nature, so it is not certain that it was in IA’s hand. The case for regarded this as a verified work rests on the internal evidence of the text. JC has identified other copies: Kastamonu 2183 fols 31a-31b (704H); Köprülü, Fazıl Ahmed Pş., ??, 87-92 s (739H?)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
690
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. al-Shaykh ilā al-imām al-Rāzī
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
