منشورات
Editions
Critical edition in progress by Muhammed Rustom, who has also published a translation of the full text: Ibn ʿArabī’s Letter to Fakhr al-dīn al-Rāzī: A Study and Translation, Journal of Islamic Studies 25:2 (2014), pp. 113-137 Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī.
طبعات
Translations

R. Rūḥ al-quds fī munāṣaḥat al-nafs
رسالة روح القدس في مناصحة النفس

639

ruh

R. Rūḥ al-quds fī munāṣaḥat al-nafs
رسالة روح القدس في مناصحة النفس
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
The Holy Spirit in the Counselling of the Soul
بديل
English
The Holy Spirit in the Counselling of the Soul
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
min al-ʿabd al-ḍaʿīf al-nāṣiḥ al-shafīq al-maʾmūr bi-l-naṣḥ

حمدله

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mecca
مكان
Date
600H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
600
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise originally addressed to Ibn ʿArabī’s friend in Tunis, al-Mahdawī, describing the way in which the soul is educated and advised by the Holy Spirit through the example of previous generations, present-day masters and by direct inspiration. The middle section, describing his early education with over 70 teachers in Spain and North Africa, was translated by R W J Austin in the 1970s and published as Sufis of Andalusia (London, 1971); it has subsequently become one of the best known texts by IA in modern times.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is undoubtedly University A79 which is in the hand of SQ’s father and is the riwāya (transmission) of al-Ḥabashī, dated 600H, with at least nine samāʿs in IA’s lifetime.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
600
Library
Code
Pag-es
R. Rūḥ al-quds fī munāṣaḥat al-nafs
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition, alongside an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2012). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī.
طبعات
Translations
There is no complete translation of this work. The following cover only four of its five parts. Partial English translation (middle section) by R W J Austin: Sufis of Andalusia, London, 1971; reprinted Hawick, 2001. Partial English translation (first and last sections) by Roger Boase and Farid Sahnoun: ‘Excerpts from the Epistle on the Spirit of Holiness’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), Ed. Stephen Hirtenstein and Michael Tiernan, Oxford, 1993. Partial French translation by R W J Austin; Gérard Lecomte: Les Soufis d'Andalousie : (Rûh al-quds et ad-Durrat al-fâkhirah), Paris 1979; 1988.
Partial Spanish translations by Miguel Asín Palacios: Vidas de Santones Andaluces, Madrid, 1935. Partial Spanish translation of Part 3 by Miguel Asín Palacios: Risalat al-Quds, Madrid 1939. Partial Spanish translation by R W J Austin, David García Valverde: Los Sufis de Andalucia, Malaga, 1990. Partial German translation by Alma Geise: Ibn ʿArabī: Urwolke und Welt, Munich 2002.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

The stories are translated by R W J Austin as Sufis of Andalusia. The Ghurab edition is not a critical edition.

Sharḥ Khalʿ al-naʿlayn
شرح خلع النعلين
RG №
681

sharh-khal

Sharḥ Khalʿ al-naʿlayn
شرح خلع النعلين
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
al-hamdu lillahī rabb al-ʿālamīn arād al-ḥamd al-muqayyid
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها

Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
640
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Commentary on the work of the Andalusian mystic, Abū al-Qāsim b. Qasiy, (d. 546/1151, Marrakesh). He claimed to be the Mahdī, and organised an anti-Almoravid rebellion in the Algarve. IA claims to have met his son in 590H. IA was very critical of his ideas in this work. See Addas Quest for the Red Sulphur, (Cambridge, 1993. pp. 55-7) for more on both the original and the commentary.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., of which we have investigated four. The work is verified by three historic works: Shehit Ali 1174 (741H, copied from an original riwāya Ibn Sawdakīn), Veliyuddin 1673 (677H) and Yusuf Ağa 7838 (640H from SQ’s library). There is also a work of the same title attributed to ʿAbd Allah Bosnevi (d. 1054/1644) which has caused some confusion.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
640
Library
Code
Pag-es
Sharḥ Khalʿ al-naʿlayn
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Damascus
مكان
Date
621
تاريخ
Earliest MS
617
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Maxims, consisting of a number of short conundrums, counsels, instruction, intimations, quotations and allusions. Gerald Elmore (see ‘A Selection of texts on the theme of praise from some gnomic works by Ibn ʿArabī’ in JMIAS 23, pp. 58-85) feels that this text is closely related to K, al-Tarājim (RG 737), which is probably the ‘mother’ text, but further research is needed to ascertain which came first.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which six can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4868, which is an autograph, but the ms. has been stolen and we only have a digitised microfilm copy. The next best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in Damascus and read back to the author).
Date

Summary

K. Shawāhid al-ḥaqq fī al-qalb

Ikhtiṣār al-sīra al-nabawiyya al-Muḥammadiyya
إختصار السيرة النبوية المحمدية
RG №
276
Alt. RG №
xml:id
sira
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Ikhtiṣār al-sīra al-nabawiyya al-Muḥammadiyya
إختصار السيرة النبوية المحمدية

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
701
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Work ascribed to IA on the life and qualities of the Prophet, including the palm-tree miracle in Seville. The text has been analysed by Pablo Beneito (JMIAS 30, 2001).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites no surviving mss., but we have inspected an early mss. in Jerusalem (Khalidiyya 967, 701H, of which there is a microfilm copy in the Dār al-kutub, Cairo.) which carries a dedication to IA’s sons and his daughter Fāṭima. This makes it highly likely that it is an authentic work. The work is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269) and internal evidence as presented by Pablo Beneito (see JMIAS 30, 2001) supports the verification. There is some confusion between this work and K. al-Shamāʾil al-nabī, for which OY lists three mss and assigned a separate RG number (669). But our research so far indicates that there is only one work with variant titles. We have therefore consolidated under RG 276 and categorised RG 669 as a duplicate.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
701
Library
Code
Pag-es
Ikhtiṣār al-sīra al-nabawiyya al-Muḥammadiyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

K. al-Tadbīrāt al-ilāhiyya
كتاب التدبيرات الإلهية
RG №
716
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tadbirat
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Tadbīrāt al-ilāhiyya
كتاب التدبيرات الإلهية
موحد
Full
K. al-Tadbirat al-ilāhiya fī iṣlāḥ al-mamlaka al-insāniyya
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي

Textual Identifiers

al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī istakhraja al-insān min wujūd ʿilmihi
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة

Khuṭba

ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mawrūr (Andalusia)
مكان
Date
>595H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<638
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
This is one of IA’s earliest works, written in four days during a visit to his friend al-Mawrūrī in the village of Moron in Andalusia. It was inspired by Sirr al-Asrār (The Secrets of Secrets) by pseudo-Aristotle concerning the nature of government, with IA adding a spiritual dimension to the discussion. In 21 chapters, it explains the correspondences between the external political hierarchy of princes and rulers, and the inner rulership of the spirit within the human being.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least three historic mss. The best is probably Leiden Or 86, written possibly in 606H. Also Corum 756 (part 1) and Yusuf Ağa 4859 (part 2) from SQ’s library, which were originally the same document, undated. Yusuf Aga 4859 was stolen but a copy exists on digitised microfilm. Koprulu 713 seems to be a complete copy of this original dated 663H. OY also lists four commentaries, including one by al-Dāmūnī (d. 1199/1785).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Tadbīrāt al-ilāhiyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

34

Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
An edition established by H S Nyberg in Kleinere Schriften des Ibn al-ʿArabî, (Leiden, 1919). A recent critical edition, plus an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2014), edited by Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. This is based upon the best early manuscripts as found in the MIAS archive, including Yusuf Ağa 4859 and Koprulu 713, but not the autograph Leiden Or 86, which had not yet been identified when the text was edited.
طبعات
Translations
English translation by Shaykh Tosun Bayrak: Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom, plus ‘What the seeker needs’ and ‘Treatise on Unity’, Louisville, 1997.
Spanish translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi al-Halveti, Afife Traverso and Emilio Alzueta: El divino gobierno del reino humano, Lo que necesita el buscador tratador sobre el uno y único, Granada, 2004.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions

A very interpretative translation exists by Tosun Bayrak called ‘Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom’
Asin Palacios, in El. Isl, Crist, pp352-370

Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
630
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Extract from an exegesis on the Fātiḥa, why it is called the opening, etc. The original source is not known, but our researches show that it is a precious copy of a text also found on 1a of Evkaf Muzesi 1933, the copy of Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam in SQ’s handwriting, which is now not fully readable.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There is only one ms. listed in OY (he also erroneously classifies it under RG 684). We have found another ms., Halet 809, which is identical (NB: OY also lists this as RG 731). The Shehit Ali text mentions “our shaykh Abū Madyan saying that he never saw a thing except that there was the letter bāʾ over it”, which makes this a bona fide ms.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
630
Library

Faṣl mufīd fī tafsīr Fātiḥat al-Kitāb

al-Juzʾ al-awwal min tafsīr kalām Allāh taʿālā
الجزء الأول من تفسير كلام الله تعالى
RG №
188.1
Alt. RG №
xml:id

درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity

Place

Date
تاريخ

977
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
An exposition on the Fātiḥa, the first sura of the Qurʿan, and part of the second, Surat al-Baqara. At the end, it is said that this is not the ‘great tafsīr’ of the Shaykh (see RG 172).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one ms., Shehit Ali 2717 (977H), with a note saying it was taken from a copy made in 875H by Ibn ʿAzm, who copied an original recited by al-Qunawi to the author. Not the same as Dugumlu 9.

Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
مكان
Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
876
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Long poem with the end rhyme in tāʾ, with commentary by Bosnevi.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., of which none are historic. All texts are relatively late and without special provenance, so it must be considered unverified. Ryad Atlagh is convinced that it is authentic and has presented his arguments in a paper The Phenomenology of the Perfect Man in The Tāʾiyya of Ibn ʿArabī (unpublished, MIAS Symposium, Oxford 1998). All copies we have seen are attributed to IA (varying in length but at least 400 verses). A line-by-line commentary by Abdullah Bosnevi entitled Qurrat ʿayn al-shuhūd also testifies to its authorship by IA. In light of the importance given by Bosnevi to this poem, it is most likely that the original Tāʾiyya should be considered as an authentic work. Critical edition by Yusuf ‘Awda (Cairo, 2015)
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
876
Library
Code
Pag-es
al-Tāʾiyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Note on Textual Identifiers

صحة النسبة

Ibn al-ʿArabī

Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mecca
مكان
Date
600
تاريخ
Earliest MS
600
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A series of eight love-letters to the Kaʿba, composed after a visionary experience there in 600H.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 20 mss., of which one can be considered definitively historic: Veliyuddin 1759, 600H, al-Ḥabashī’s certified copy, with three samāʿ. According to both OY and Stephen Hirtenstein, it is an autograph.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
600
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Tāj al-rasāʾil
One line summary. This entry is only an example!
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
relation
Note on Related Works

إلى هذا المصنف
Ijāza
68

الإجازة
Fihrist
51

الفهرست

الفتوحات
Other
Reference in other work(s)
To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition in progress by Denis Gril. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
طبعات
Translations
A partial translation and article by Denis Gril in ‘Love Letters to the Kaʾba; a presentation of Ibn ʿArabī’s Tāj al-Rasāʾil’, JMIAS 17, 1995, pp. 41-54.
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add Sur les circonstances de la rédaction de cet ouvrage, voir Addas, Ibn Arabî ou la quête du Soufre rouge, p.253-254 (Quest for the Red Sulphur, pp. 211-213). Cor Il ne s'agit pas d'un recueil de sept épîtres comme l'indique O. Y., mais de huit épîtres. O.Y. mentionne en fait comme une seule épître (Lettre divine sacro-sainte) deux épîtres distinctes (Risâla ilâhiyya/Risâla qudsiyya). La troisième lettre de sa liste-la quatrième en fait-est intitulée par lui "lettre seigneuriale". Or le titre arabe, tel qu'il figure dans le ms. autographe, n'est pas risâla rabbâniyya comme cette traduction le donnerait à penser mais Risâla suryâniyya (autre lecture possible : Risâla sarayâniyya, hypothèse qui serait à mettre en relation avec la formulation sarayân al-ma'bûd fî l-wujûd qui apparaît à la fin de l'ouvrage, f. 144a du ms autographe). O.Y. a sans doute retenu le nombre sept parce qu'il correspond manifestement à celui des tournées rituelles autour de la Ka'ba. Ce symbolisme semble remis en question par l'existence de huit épîtres ; or une phrase de la quatrième lettre montre qu'il n'en est rien : elle rappelle en effet qu'au terme des sept tournées le rite du tawâf doit se clore par un huitième acte-l'accomplissement d'une prière de 2 rak'at devant le maqâm ibrâhîm. S'il est donc en parfaite cohérence avec les gestes successifs prescrits au pèlerin lorsqu'il arrive devant la Ka'ba, le nombre huit trouve son explication la plus profonde dans la nature des termes, chaque fois différent, par lesquels Ibn Arabî se désigne lui-même au début de chaque épître : il se présente d'abord comme 'Abd Allâh puis comme 'Abd al-Hayy, 'Abd al-'Alîm, 'Abd al-Shakûr, 'Abd al-Basîr, 'Abd al-Samî', 'Abd al-Wadûd et enfin 'Abd al-Qâdir. Ces huit dénominations correspondent de toute évidence au Nom de l'Essence (Allâh) puis aux sept attributs qui se manifestent à lui dans sa contemplation du Bayt Allâh et définissent chacun un aspect particulier de sa 'ubûdiyya. (MC)
Critical edition and French translation in progress by Denis Gril.

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
Add Sur les circonstances de la rédaction de cet ouvrage, voir Addas, Ibn Arabî ou la quête du Soufre rouge, p.253-254 (Quest for the Red Sulphur, pp. 211-213). Cor Il ne s'agit pas d'un recueil de sept épîtres comme l'indique O. Y., mais de huit épîtres. O.Y. mentionne en fait comme une seule épître (Lettre divine sacro-sainte) deux épîtres distinctes (Risâla ilâhiyya/Risâla qudsiyya). La troisième lettre de sa liste-la quatrième en fait-est intitulée par lui "lettre seigneuriale". Or le titre arabe, tel qu'il figure dans le ms. autographe, n'est pas risâla rabbâniyya comme cette traduction le donnerait à penser mais Risâla suryâniyya (autre lecture possible : Risâla sarayâniyya, hypothèse qui serait à mettre en relation avec la formulation sarayân al-ma'bûd fî l-wujûd qui apparaît à la fin de l'ouvrage, f. 144a du ms autographe). O.Y. a sans doute retenu le nombre sept parce qu'il correspond manifestement à celui des tournées rituelles autour de la Ka'ba. Ce symbolisme semble remis en question par l'existence de huit épîtres ; or une phrase de la quatrième lettre montre qu'il n'en est rien : elle rappelle en effet qu'au terme des sept tournées le rite du tawâf doit se clore par un huitième acte-l'accomplissement d'une prière de 2 rak'at devant le maqâm ibrâhîm. S'il est donc en parfaite cohérence avec les gestes successifs prescrits au pèlerin lorsqu'il arrive devant la Ka'ba, le nombre huit trouve son explication la plus profonde dans la nature des termes, chaque fois différent, par lesquels Ibn Arabî se désigne lui-même au début de chaque épître : il se présente d'abord comme 'Abd Allâh puis comme 'Abd al-Hayy, 'Abd al-'Alîm, 'Abd al-Shakûr, 'Abd al-Basîr, 'Abd al-Samî', 'Abd al-Wadûd et enfin 'Abd al-Qâdir. Ces huit dénominations correspondent de toute évidence au Nom de l'Essence (Allâh) puis aux sept attributs qui se manifestent à lui dans sa contemplation du Bayt Allâh et définissent chacun un aspect particulier de sa 'ubûdiyya.

K. Tāj al-tarājim

617
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Maxims, consisting of a number of short conundrums, counsels, instruction, intimations, quotations and allusions. Gerald Elmore (see ‘A Selection of texts on the theme of praise from some gnomic works by Ibn ʿArabī’ in JMIAS 23, pp. 58-85) feels that this text is closely related to K. al-Shawāhid (RG 689), but further research is needed to ascertain which came first. See Chodkiewicz, Ocean, 90–94.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 23 mss., of which four can be considered historic. The best is a holograph, Yusuf Ağa 4868 (ms. stolen, so only a digitised microfilm is now available). Ayasofia 4817 is dated 649H in Konya and was possibly read before SQ.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
617
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. Tāj al-tarājim
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition, alongside an Urdu translation, forthcoming by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī but not yet published. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.

K. al-Tajalliyāt

al-ḥamdu lillāh muḥkim al-ʿaql al-rāsikh fī ʿālam al-barāzikh

توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Aleppo
مكان
Date
606
تاريخ
Earliest MS
620
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Descriptions of 109 theophanies or ‘unveilings’, including IA’s encounters and conversations in the intermediary world (barzakh) with his predecessors, such as Sahl al-Tustārī, Dhū al-Nūn, Junayd etc., which illustrate themes such as unification, perfection, generosity and compassion.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least five historical mss. The best is Veliyuddin 1759 (620H, holograph, with a samāʿ in Damascus in the house of IA). The earliest copy is held in Awqāf Baghdad 36175 (OY: 4827), dated 606H, and transcribed into a modern edition by ʿAlī Daḥrūj
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
620
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Tajalliyāt
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

Criical Edition published by Osman Yahia alongside Ibn Sawdakīn’s commentary Kashf al-Ghayāt (Tehran, 1988). Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.

Takhmīs qaṣīdat Abī Madyan
تخميس قصيدة أبي مدين
RG №
748
Alt. RG №
xml:id
takhmis

عنوان
Uniform
Takhmīs qaṣīdat Abī Madyan
تخميس قصيدة أبي مدين

yā ṭālib min ladhādhāt al-dunā wa-ṭarā

أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Strophic poem consisting of 5-line stanzas – a poetic expansion of verses by Abū Madyan. See translation and study by Gerald Elmore: ‘Ibn al-ʿArabī’s ‘Cinquain’ (Takhmīs) on a poem by Abū Madyan’ in Arabica Vol. 46, 1998, pp. 63-96.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only three mss. listed by OY. We have looked at two of them, both late copies with no historical evidence to support attribution to IA. The content, however, strongly favours the attribution. See translation and study by Gerald Elmore in Arabica Vol. 46, 1998, pp. 63-96. Further work needed.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
>1000
Library
Code
Pag-es
Takhmīs qaṣīdat Abī Madyan

K. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya
كتاب التنزلات الموصلية
RG №
762
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tanazzulat
Title
عنوان
Uniform
K. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya
كتاب التنزلات الموصلية
موحد
Full
K. al-Tanazzulât al-mawsiliyya fi asrâr al-tahârât wa al-salawât wa-l-ayyâm al-asliyya:
كامل
Variant
Tanazzul al-imlâk li-l-amlâk fi harakât al-aflâk: K. tanazzul al-imlâk min ‘âlam al-arwâh wa-l aflâk.
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers

Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waṣafa al-insān bi-mā waṣafa bihi nafsahu

Note on Authenticity

تاريخ

620
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Work composed in Mosul in 601H, on the esoteric significance of ablution and prayers, describing how each phase of everyday ritual is imbued with meaning. Consists of 55 chapters.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 31 mss., and it is verified by at least nine historic mss. The best is a holograph, Murad Bukhari 162 (with a samāʿ dated 620H and a note verifying that it was written by IA), Murad Molla 1257 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr) and Yusuf Ağa 4861 (written by SQ).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
620
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

55
Reference to work in the Ijāza

53
Reference to work in the Fihrist

To other works
إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition has been done by Kerim Lahan but as yet unpublished as far as we know. Critical edition by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan), ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, , but not yet published Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.
طبعات
Translations

تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
Additions
Add Une première édition a été publiée au Caire en 1961 par Ahmad Zakî 'Atiya et 'Abd al-Bâqî Surûr sous le titre Latâ'if al-asrâr. Une deuxième édition a été publiée au Caire également, en 1986, par le shaykh 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd sous le titre Tanazzulât mawsiliyya . Ni l'une ni l'autre (basées sur des mss. égyptiens) ne répond aux critères d'une édition scientifique. Une édition critique, établie en vue du Ph.D. à Cambridge en 1996, doit paraître prochainement à Beyrouth. Elle est due à Karîm Lahhâm, qui a recensé 35 mss. (O.Y. en recensait 30 mais, par suite de doubles emplois, sa liste se ramenait en fait à 27 mss.)L'édition à venir de Karîm Lahhâm est basée principalement sur le ms. autographe (Murâd Bukhari 162) et celui transcrit par Qûnâwî (Yusûf Aga 4861) mais note aussi les variantes relevées dans huit autres mss. Elle comporte 55 chapitres (et non 53 comme indiquée par O.Y.). L'introduction met en évidence la complémentarité entre le thème de la descente, développée dans les 45 premiers chapitres, et celui de l'ascension (mi'râj) qui caractérise les 10 derniers chapitres. (MC)
A critical edition and translation has been done by Kerim Lahham as a PhD thesis, unpublished.

إضافات
Comments and Corrections
تعليق وتدقيق
corrections
additions
RG 762 Tanazzulât mawsiliyya Add Une première édition a été publiée au Caire en 1961 par Ahmad Zakî 'Atiya et 'Abd al-Bâqî Surûr sous le titre Latâ'if al-asrâr. Une deuxième édition a été publiée au Caire également, en 1986, par le shaykh 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd sous le titre Tanazzulât mawsiliyya . Ni l'une ni l'autre (basées sur des mss. égyptiens) ne répond aux critères d'une édition scientifique. Une édition critique, établie en vue du Ph.D. à Cambridge en 1996, doit paraître prochainement à Beyrouth. Elle est due à Karîm Lahhâm, qui a recensé 35 mss. (O.Y. en recensait 30 mais, par suite de doubles emplois, sa liste se ramenait en fait à 27 mss.)L'édition à venir de Karîm Lahhâm est basée principalement sur le ms. autographe (Murâd Bukhari 162) et celui transcrit par Qûnâwî (Yusûf Aga 4861) mais note aussi les variantes relevées dans huit autres mss. Elle comporte 55 chapitres (et non 53 comme indiquée par O.Y.). L'introduction met en évidence la complémentarité entre le thème de la descente, développée dans les 45 premiers chapitres, et celui de l'ascension (mi'râj) qui caractérise les 10 derniers chapitres.
msAdditions
Murad Bukhari 162 which carries a sama‘ of 620H, approved, read and written by IA

Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
Treatise on the Real Being.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one ms. of this work, Murad Bukhari 207/1-15. OY says that it is copied from an original, but we have inspected the text and find that the only support for this is a note on the fihris which may or may not cover all the works. Identical to K. al-Ḥaqq (RG 219) (SH).

Manuscript
Title
Summary
875

الإجازة
Fihrist
Reference to work in the Fihrist

Tarjumān al-ashwāq
ترجمان الأشواق
RG №
767
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tarjuman
Title
عنوان
Uniform
Tarjumān al-ashwāq
ترجمان الأشواق
موحد
Full
كامل
Variant
بديل
English
إنجليزي
Note on Title
Textual Identifiers
معرفات نصية
Incipit
Al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥusn al-faʿʿāl al-jamīl alladhī yuhibb al-jamāl… layta shiʿrī hal darū ayyā qalbin malakū
حمدله
حمدله
Intro
Muqadimma
مقدمة
مقدمة
Khuṭba
Khuṭba
الخطبة بكاملها

Explicit
Khiṭām al-naṣṣ
ختام النص
ختام
Note on Textual Identifiers
Authorship
صحة النسبة
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
مؤلف
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Mecca
مكان
Date
611
تاريخ
Earliest MS
<800
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
61 mystical love poems to the Divine Beauty, in the qaṣīda form of pre-Islamic poetry. According to Pablo Beneito (Qurrat al-ʿAyn, 2020), the original collection was 60 odes, to which were added first one then two poems in the preface. It was composed in 611H in Mecca, although the inspiration came in 604H in the meeting with Qurrat al-ʿAyn.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, both on its own and with the commentary (RG116). There are no definitive historic mss. to verify the text in its own right, but there are several for the commentary, which includes the text of the poems. The best copies are therefore contained within mss. of Dhakhāʾir . The best stand-alone mss. are Manisa 6596 (undated, taken from SQ’s copy), and Ragib Pasha 1453 (although very late, probably also taken from SQ’s copy). There is an issue with the preface on this work. There are two basic variants; some mss carry the same preface as the commentary, Dhakhāʾir al-alāq (RG 116. Others have a longer version which begin with a khutba and IA’s account of meeting the young girl, Niẓam, who inspired the poems in Mecca. The situation is complex, with several other variants appearing in some mss (see Jane Clark Mystical Perception and Beauty: Ibn ʿArabī’s Preface to Tarjumān al-Ashwāq in JMIAS 55, 2013).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<800
Library
Code
Pag-es
Tarjumān al-ashwāq

Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical Edition published by R A Nicholson and published alongside his English translation The Tarjumān al-ashwāq (London, 1911). However, the manuscripts he used were all late and had no special provenance.
طبعات
Translations
Full English translation of the poems, but not the commentary, by R A Nicholson: The Tarjumān al-ashwāq, London, 1911. Full English translation by Michael Sells: The Translator of Desires, Princeton, 2021. Partial English translation by Michael Sells: Stations of Desire, Jerusalem, 2000. Translation of the Preface by Jane Clark available on http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/articlespdf/preface-tarjuman-al-ashwaq.pdf French translation of poems and commentary by Maurice Gloton, L’interprète des désirs, Paris, 1996. Partial French translation by Mahmoud Sami-Ali: Le chant de l'ardent désir, Arles 2006. Italian translation by Roberto Rossi Testa, L’interprete delle passioni, Milano, 2008
Spanish translation by Carlos Varona Narvión: El intérprete de los deseos, Murcia, 2002. Partial German translation by Alma Geise: Ibn ʿArabī: Urwolke und Welt, Munich 2002.

ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz

TPQ-TAQ

نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
The perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil) and the multiple degrees of Being from the most elevated orders of the Archangels to inorganic nature (OY).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
An often copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4690 (undated and incomplete, but in IA’s handwriting); also Shehit Ali 1341 (725H, said to have been taken from an original, which may have been by IA) and Ayasofya 4875 (dated 753H).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
<638
Library
Code
Pag-es
ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

ya waladī awṣika bi-taqwā allāh
حمدله

أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists only one ms., Ayasofia 376 (997H), on which the Hyderabad 1948 Rasāʾil Ibn ʿArabi is based. Julian Cook argues that this is a distinct work from RG 821 (of which RG 817 is a duplicate). He has identified that within the text there are three poems (pp. 2, 5 and 7), each of which is also found in ch. 560 of Futuhat – also known as RG 818 Waṣāyā (or even Waṣiyya). So it could well be this work is in fact a set of extracts from there. Further investigation required.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
Library
Code

درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition

Date
تاريخ
Earliest MS
777
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
According to OY, deals with intuitive knowledge and how this can be obtained.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 6 mss., none of which can be considered historic. Carullah 2080 (c791H in Konya) is listed by OY as being copied from an original but we could find no specific note to this effect on the text. There are a number of works with similar titles, and there is much work to be done in distinguishing them from one another. However, there is a definite unique work listed here under RG 821, with at least four mss. (Carullah 2070, Husein Celebi 448, Milli 489 and Shehit Ali 1344) being versions of the same text. N.B. OY also lists Shehit Ali 1344 under RG 817.
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
777
Library
Code

Waṣiyya fī kayfiyyat ḥuṣūl al-maʿrifa al-quṣwā

Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
A short note of advice to one of his close friends on the beneficial effects of remembrance (dhikr).
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., of which one can be considered historic: Hamidiye 188 (c.1005H taken from an original dated 624H).

Note on Textual Identifiers

Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
توثيق
Note on Authenticity
Composition
تأليف
Place
Hebron
مكان
Date
602H
تاريخ
Earliest MS
825
أقدم شاهد
TPQ-TAQ
Earliest–Latest
نطاق زمني
Other roles
أدوار أخرى
role
Other Roles
Contents
مضمون
Description
On the intuitive knowledge which leads to certitude. Written in Palestine in the Mosque of Yaqīn (see Veliyuddin 1826). Shehit Ali 1341 also has a note about its composition in 602H, stating that it was written in one day on Wednesday 14th Shawwāl 602H on the way to visit the tombs of Lot and Abraham.
وصف
Structure
Structure of Work
تقسيم
Note on Contents
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 27 mss., of which at least two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1826 (c.825H, copied from an original by Ayyūb b. Badr and read before IA in 621H).
Date
Manuscript
Title
Summary
825
Library
Code
Pag-es
K. al-Yaqīn
One line summary. This entry is only an example!

إلى مصنفات أخرى
Work
Reference to other work
Note on Cross-references
Publications
منشورات
Editions
Critical edition (based upon early manuscripts from MIAS archive) by Maurizio Marconi, alongside an Italian translation. Azufre Rojo vol. 7 (2020) Critical edition in progress by Michael Ebstein, Martin Buber fellow at Hebrew University of Jerusalem. Completion expected Autumn 2014.
